content:
Posted: January 25, 2016
BRINK: Proving that great ideas don't always make great games.Despite this game being released 4 years ago, I picked it up and wanted to give it a shot. Lots of people were furious over this game and how disappointing it was. Lots of awesome trailers and mechanics to show off such as Brink's S.M.A.R.T. mechanic (Smooth Movement Around Rough Terrain) and dynamic objectives. Even as it is right now, I'm loving and hating this game.MULTIPLAYER:There are less than 20 players global. Unless you are lucky and get some friends to play with you, you won't get much fun out of this deserted game" (That is if the game doesn't give you connectivity issues).Story:Well...there isn't exactly a story. The "Singleplayer mode" is just multiplayer maps with bots. However, I liked the setup for Brink. Humanity has fled to a manmade island called "The Ark". This island was able to renew resources and allow a safe last place for people to live in. "Was". The Ark is running low on resources and has lost communication from the outside world. Two factions: The Resistance (made up of refugees) and the Ark Security (basically the cops), are at a war. The resistance wants to escape the Ark while Security is trying to save it. Besides a short one minute cutscene at the beginning of every mission with some interaction between characters, that's as much as you will get storywise. Gameplay:I'm guessing the developers made the AI "dumb" so that in multiplayer, the AI would not be able to "play the game for you" (similar to the bots in Titanfall that don't alter the gameplay much).However, the singleplayer mode is going to torture you. The AI will constantly go for the secondary objectives such as taking command posts (you will hear them chatting about this A LOT) and build turrets near your spawn. Medics will still revive you, but that's even if they don't get swarmed by three enemies. It doesn't help that the enemy AI seems to be much smarter than your team AI. Also, the difficulty of the AI scales to your level so playing a hard mission at Level 1 is just as challenging as playing an easy mission at Level 10.Gunplay...well, it plays like your typical modern shooter. You have 4 classes: Assault, Medic, Engineer, and Operative (Like the spy from Team Fortress 2). There are 3 body types: Light (moves the fastest), Medium, and Heavy (Terrible because you gain only an additional 40 health and you can barely move as fast).Level design isn't helping Brink much either. Levels will either end with stalemates or they are extremely one sided. Take the mission "Early Launch" for example. On the security side, it might be a bit hard to repair the crane controls at first, but eventually, when you have to hack the missile controls, its ridiculous. Why? Because the Resistance spawn point is RIGHT IN FRONT of the objectives and the security spawn is all the way at the other end of the map. It also doesn't help when you have the AI as I described above.Customization:Alright, I can at least give some props to the design team. I really liked the customization options for styling your character, even if you rarely look at characters in game. You could get tattoos, change color of your clothes...and that's probably it.Weapon customization is a bit nice. You can customize sights, barrel attachments such as grenade launchers and bayonets, and different sizes of magazines.Graphics:A smooth art style with "unique" character design. Backgrounds would look nice if they weren't so low res. Otherwise, the art style is similar to games like Team Fortress 2 and RAGE.Sound:The only reason I wanted to give Brink a shot was because I found a Youtube playlist with game soundtracks and Brink's main theme was playing. While many FPS games have fast adrenaline pumping music, Brink's OST is calm and ambient. Weapon sounds aren't much, they are self explanatory.Should you get Brink?Unless you are like me and you want to experience what a game that was supposed to compete with TF2 should have been, then buy it. The Agents of Change DLC may give you an extra hour or two of funtime. Otherwise, I would not recommend buying Brink. Not even during a sale.

content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
												Alright, let's put aside the hate and generalized distaste for this game and actually break it down into something that may be worth your time. Now, to start out, I would like to say that I pre-ordered this game the day I heard about it and the day the developers released a video on  the vaulting mechanics. I played the crap out of this game for a while and I didn't care what other people thought (partly because I didn't know people hated it until long after I defeated the game and unlocked all of the guns, outfits, and most of the skills/attachments). Truly, this game is a lot of fun. Think of this game as a really watered down version of TF2 with classes such as the Engineer or Operator (hacker, etc.) that can be switched around with others on the fly. The gun play may not be the best but it really is fun when you start leveling your character and unlocking stuff. Attachments help a lot and skills do as well such as having third person when interacting with the objectives in-game. -(Note that I am writing this review years after I stopped playing)-.The story is something that I felt like was just a filler for the story missions, in the beginning, but as you progress that slowly changes. Throughout the game you can find dialogues and journal entries that really add to the game's back-story and adds some real character that would have been otherwise unkown in-game. The end mission is really intense and a lot of fun whether or not you win or not. The game sets itself up for a sequel, but it looks like it may never happen in the near future. Truly, this game had a lot of heart and some pretty good art-design with some great back-story that would have made this game a real hit. Game mechanic choices and poor decisions really watered this game down to the point where no one likes it but the selective few like myself. In reality, I am writing this review out of nostalgia out of the lots of fun I had with this game. Pick it up if you would like sometime soon, fairly small and can be run pretty easily with any system. I would suggest getting it on sale because it may not be worth the full price. Thank you for your time and have a wonderful day.

content:
Posted: May 2, 2014
												This is probably one of the most underrated games of the 21st century. I picked it up back on the PS3 originally, and despite it's flaws at launch such as mediocre AI and minor lag, (issues that were improved later into the games life) it was an absolute blast to play. The varying levels of customization were great, spanning all the way from weapons to the character itself. Not only that, but all the maps played well and looked absoulutely georgeous. The gameplay was a refreshing change to what you experienced in most FPS games at the time, with fun and flamboyant free running moves that not only looked great but were simple to execute. However, because Brink was developed by 'Splash Damage' and not 'Infinity Ward' websites such as IGN and Gamespot gave it a 6, slamming the game for it's poor AI and repetition. Sure I'd accept that if this was a game that based itself around singleplayer rather than multiplayer gameplay, but marking it down for repetition when video games such as Modern Warfare 2 get given 9's is ridiculous.At the end of the day, this was a game that had it's head put on the block before it even got released. Sure, it's far from perfect, but it's as good as your going to get if your looking for a multiplayer FPS that's a little different from the norm.

Posted: November 30, 2014
												I loved Brink. Back in 2011 Brink brought some fresh air in the multiplayer FPS community. It required a lot of teamplay and skills related to movement & aim. Brink is different because of its many different game modes, a highly customizable character (skins & guns) and the way each mission is going on (meaning in 1 mp game you can be required to set up a charge & escort a vip..) I'm more than ok graphically if you can withstand the futuristic theme. The solo is awful and more like a training for the multiplayer. It's also one of the first (the first?) to bring the "parkour"movement style you can find later in Battlefield 3.BUTI played Brink as much as i could and in my gamer's life, Brink is the only game i had to stop because no one was playing anymore. It's unfair because this game is still really great...With a tear in the eye, do not buy this game...

number of helpful: 100 of 150 people (67%) found this review helpful12 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
												So, not too long ago I made a review on Dirty Bomb, a game made by the same Devs that made Brink, and that got me thinking... Why I never made a Brink Review? Well, not anymore. As usual, I'll start with the BAD details of the game, then switch to the good ones:First and foremost, the game is stupidly short. Well, more like the devs were lazy. Both stories use the same maps, and there's like only 8 or 10 of them. While the story is well voice-acted, you don't even get to know ANYTHING about the characters or factions. It just feels like the game was supposed to be twice as big and they ran out of time.Second, when it came out, lag was an insane pain in the balls. I haven't played in years, but lag can still be found at times.Third issue it has, is the redundancy of the classes. There's 4 classes, they all use the same guns, only difference is the special equipment. That's dumb, specially when the game was SO based in Team Fortress 2. Funny thing is, Dirty Bomb, the "spiritual succesor" of the game, felt into the same God-damn mistake, and it failed even harder by blocking most of the game behind pay-walls.Lastly, another big issue the game had is how fast the Devs ditched it. I mean, yeah, it was a gigantic failure at release, but it had potential. Why not just stick to it and FIX IT, instead of just comming back a ton of years later to commit the same mistakes? Specially when they could have just made Free-DLC's that fix the game, and keep releasing new content by Standard DLC's.Now, the good stuff. Is the gameplay FUN? When you get over the dumb classes, IT IS! I mean yeah, nobody uses Heavy characters because movement is key, but fast characters are just fun to play with. You can move arround the map freely and it was the thing that got me attracted to the game. Quite ironic that the best thing the game had, didn't came back for Dirty Bomb.Another thing that's quite fun, is the variety of weapons: and not only weapons, but accesories for them. Like to make as less noise as possible, or to just spray bullets? You can pick most weapons and make those changes work. Ironically enough, this wasn't in Dirty Bomb as well, something that blows.Something that was also quite interesting was the customization. An insane amout of items to pick up for your avatar, making everyone look diferent on the battlefield, like in TF2 but with less flaming hats. And would you guess? Also not on Dirty Bomb.Quite frankly, I gave that game a "Not recommend", and I'm going to do the reverse here. I feel like Blink, while a mediocre game, is way better than it's EVEN MORE MEDIOCRE Pay-to-play-Cash-Grab succesor. Does that mean that you should just go right ahead and buy it? No. Wait for a sale, pick it up with friends. You will all have fun and a good time playing together. Playing it alone is kind of dumb, and you'll just do better by downloading and playing Team Fortress 2.

Posted: October 8, 2014
												A game that I hyped up to all my friends for several months prior to release.  They got a lot of things right.  They certainly had the e-sports scene covered with a well polished interface and flawless steam integration.  However, the gameplay itself was lacking.  Certain aspects of the game seemed more like a chore than enjoyment.  For example, all of the classes required you to be right next to your teamate in order to heal them or provide them additional ammo.  This is a problem when everyone is running all over the place in a combat situation.  Battlefield's approach of simply dropping a medkit container or ammo supply box was much more enjoyable.  The weapons were uninteresting and the pace of the game was far too slow to really capture anyones attention.

Posted: October 17, 2016
												Brink was promised to be the next big thing of the FPS genre and Bethesda's legendary smash hit.  Unfortunately it was far too rushed so the developers could meet corporate deadlines, meaning it couldn't possibly deliver everything that it had promised, and what we did get wasn't optimized very well. The result was extremely underwheming gameplay. By the time they got around to fixing these problems, the vast majority of the playerbase abandoned it and didn't come back.  Huge shame too, considering the amount of potential Brink had to be one of the best games ever, and I preordered it because I thought it was going to be just that.The dedicated online multiplayer servers are long gone, so there's really not much reason to recommend this one anymore. Unless you like playing by yourself on singleplayer with bots.

number of helpful: 43 of 61 people (70%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 13, 2014
												If you enjoy team gameplay like Team Fortress 2, I suggest buying Brink. Brink is a FPS game with team-oriented gameplay mechanics with medics, soldiers, engineers, and assassins. Medics can revive team members, give accelerated healing abilities to other team members, and has specified special skills and abilities. Soldiers can give ammo and can unlock grenades. Engineers are like the engineers in TF2 where they can set up sentry guns. Not only that, they can give upgraded ammo or armor to teammates and they can also drop mines. To add to that, the members all have different tasks to do such as planting C4 to blow up bridges or walls preventing escape, hacking into systems to complete tasks, and more. The "new" Call of Duty Ghosts fuction of running and then sliding was already utilized in this game where you can slide by pressing the hotkey. Sliding can also knock down enemies so you can kill them without them shooting back. Weapons are customizable and you can unlock some other weapons through mini-games. Depending on the size of the character you chose, you can parkour through maps, jumping off the walls and whatnot. The only unfortunate aspect of this game is that the multiplayer is dead. I hope that my review will cause a few of you to buy this game or to take another look at this game in your library and revitalize this great game.

number of helpful: 30 of 38 people (79%) found this review helpful8 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 2, 2016
												I'm going to give this a negative review because I think it deserves it, but christ, you want to talk about guilty pleasures? I really enjoy Brink as a game, even though there's a LOT wrong with it, but for some reason I still go back to it. That being said, I understand why a lot of people really hate this game.I wasn't part of the hype train for Brink when it came out. Brink was ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ pushed to the moon with hype, which rasied people's expectations to fatal levels. Brink tried really hard to advertise itself as a competitor to Team Fortress 2, which is not only suicide, but also a really dumb idea. If they had just changed any mention of "Class" to "Combat Role". Also, you can probably find multiple reviews saying how terrible the ♥♥♥♥ing missile hacking mission for the Secutiry is, how the Engineer is the most overpowered combat role, or even how flimsy the connecting narritive between the missions is.There are pretty much no active servers. I'm the pleb loner who's okay with playing with bots, but if you're not that interested in that, thenThe singleplayer is locked to 30FPS. It's only the singleplayer, too. If I locally host a server using the Dedicated Server Tool it runs great. As long as you know what you're doing you should be fine.The biggest thing I'll praise about this game is the sound direction. It's fantastic. I can't name a lot of other games that have more satisfying gunshots or explosions. It sounds so good!The game's theme that plays thoughout the game it also an earworm of a jingle, too. Good luck getting it out of your head.The character customization and art direction is also great. I enjoy the odd valley between realistic and cel-shaded. It almost looks like it's a rotoscope. I could fill all ten character slots you're given and come up with awesome mix-and-match designs for people. Even though you won't see it yourself most of the time unless someone disguises as you, I still enjoy it.The line "Mucho bad guys spotted!" - It's so good. It's so bad. I love it.I don't reccomend buying this game. I'm a weird extreme case where I have stockholm syndrome or something.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												Old game, old review.I actually quite like the game. The story isn't fantastic nor is a lot of things but I don't tend to notice them half the time. I only ever played with Bots because I'd imagine not many servers would be up and I don't know many people who would be up for it. Either case,Weapons. Most of the suck. Yet it got me excited when I found a combo that actually worked. Using certain attachments allowing some to shine just a little bit to be worthwhile. Unlike most where it just didn't freaking matter. Nothing was class locked but rather weight locked. Honestly made more sense this way. Same goes for actual survivability but locking down what you can and can't do with agility actions. Common sense. For a time a lot of games just class locked weapons and weights to make it difficult to play in the style that you would like. I certainly liked being a big fat guy with a chaingun throwing revive syringes at people. Also, syringes? I don't know many people who like needles and know less that would be content in jabbing themselves with a needle that may or may not be unclean. Particularly if you are Resistance.The two sides, well. I liked the Resistance far more. Disregarding how flawed the story is for both sides and the reason there has been fighting I preferred the Resistance for their badass punk style. Both sides got their 'creepy' costumes but I always went with the badass look of the Resistance. Their music was also significantly better than Security. A sense of desperation and despair with a lot of hatred. Security was just, meh. In fact Security is really nothing special. They have some sweet clothing but out of the available 'stories' they were the worst. Most bland and only partially relatable. Whenever I heard conversations about Brink I've always heard (aside from dead game, glitchy and boring) was that Resistance were cool and relatable and Security sucked♥♥♥♥♥♥Most of the maps are terrible. When fighting against AI you just hope the enemy screws up or your team actually does something useful. I will give the game credit where it is due, the AI will at least do objectives. Unlike most co-op games where they expect you, the player, to do EVERYTHING to wiping their♥♥♥♥♥for them. But boy do most of the maps suck. Only Container City really stuck for me. Because on either side it is fun. It is the most memorial out of the maps for me at least.I wished the game did better, that the Devs had stuck to it making the changes it solely needed. It was just forgotten tragicly by players and the developers all the same. BRINK wasn't on the brink of death when it released or when the Devs stopped caring. It died before they even committed to not giving a ♥♥♥♥. I still like it and I still recommend it because it is good at the things it can do.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Well, Game went Dead quite fast, and Promised more than it could hold, but it is a solid game, not good, but not terribly bad.there are 4 classes, and while everyone has it own set of skills, you can play like you want, you can be a skinny soldier who runs aross the map like the TF2 scout giving ammo to everyone, a heavy spy with a minigun who disguises himself as an enemy, or just a averagely bulid medic with a shotgun,  and you got quite a nice collection of cloths, so you can make your own unique character, may it be a street-cop, an engineer, or a heavy SWAT-Like Unit,and color the uniform how you want, as i said, your own unique character,you can also mod your weapons, give your gun a silencer, a scope, a knife (requires the agents of change dlc) a bigger ammo Magazine. so it fits your style.maps arent many there only eight (10 with the agents of chance dlc) but depending on wich site you are on you got a diffrent objective, so you have to Escort a person as security while you have to stop the same person as resistance, Or you Need to hack a terminal as Resistance, while security has to defend the Terminal, lets say the Resistance hacked the Terminal sucsessfully, the next mission could then be a Round of Capture the Flag,  in most cases is the attacking side with the various objectives, while the defender...well...defend till time runs outgraphic is a strange mix between cartoon and realistic, the faces have a slight cartoon look, with a realistic graphic over it, and the game world in general is colorfull and not brown everywhere (just like the devs wanted it, a colorfull shooter)story is Great Imo, in short, the sea level rise and million people needed to go to the so called ark, a swimming city, somewhere in the sea, but after years the place falls apart, with two sites, the slums where the Guests live and want a better life, not only because everything rusts and falls apart under thier♥♥♥♥♥♥ but they also belive that the Founders are Facists who only care about themselfs, they also do all the maintence, and the still rather clean part of the ark with the founders, who are annoyed of the guests constanst attacks and complains and belive the guests "invaded" the ark in the first place, as it wasnt planned that they live here.also, depending on wich side and mission you are on, your handler and boss of your organisation tells you a diffrent story than the other, so while the boss of the police tells you that you need a rescue a man who has a venom injected by the resistance, and dies in the next hour, the resistance leader tells you in the loading screen that the security will torture the man if they catch him.the Computer characters are smarter then they seem, so you don't need to do all the work yourself, the cpu's are smart enough to do main missions themselfs and depending on on wich difficulty you play, they almost seem like a human player, and WILL knock you out  when you fall on the ground if you play on hard or reach a certain level on easy, however, sometimes one side of the CPU can become braindead and the other Hyper-Intelligent.Skills are shattered around the levels, you need a certain level to gain skill points and ranks to purchase the skills, like reloading while running, 3rd person perspective with rotatable camera when using something, or have class relevant skills, like the soldiers flashbang, or the engineers sentry.Overall i would rate this game around 7/10   it had good looks, but promised more then it could hold and therefore fell flat on its face, but it is still a Solid and nice shooter who can make your weekend if you let it

number of helpful: 37 of 52 people (71%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												This is unfortunately, a disaster-piece wrapped up in a package that really destroyed my hope for this game when I received it. I found myself... forcing myself to have fun playing it - and a game shouldn't make anyone do that. I played through both of the very underwhelming "campaigns" that are mostly the same levels just on the opposite teams with a friend. That's what made it and any other less-than-acceptable game fun. Playing with a friend. It has it's great moments and the music is STELLAR. I regularly listen to parts of the OST while doing other things, or playing other games. The atmosphere is wonderful, and the story is pretty engaging at first.Then, there's the gameplay and the AI. In the beginning, it's not so bad. Wow, I can do parkour as a light class, this is awesome! Oh, I'm dead already - OK, let's try a medium class. Okay... let's try a heavy class. It comes down to what's right for the moment, which is a good thing. But your impact on the level you're currently playing is totally underwhelming and there are a lot of really cheesy actions you can perform that don't encourage strategy and counter-play.Online, netcode is downright appalling. This -could- have been fixed since I played last, but it doesn't appear to be. Players constantly rubber-banding and shifting around, suddenly finding yourself dead frequently without being able to determine where you could improve your own gameplay is an atrocity.Simply, it WASN'T fun. What was fun, was hanging out with a friend and playing the game. Even with games that are intentionally satirical and are at their core dismal are similar experiences to this so long as you're playing with a friend.

number of helpful: 85 of 139 people (61%) found this review helpful12 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
												This game is fantastic.  Did I expect it to have a call of duty-style campaign? No because I'm not an idiot.  I know that isn't what was shown in trailers and that Splash Damage (the developers) were obviously making a 3rd Enemy Territory game.  It's also fantastic that this game has GOOD BOTS since I always play the games I want instead of whatever anyone else is playing.  Servers don't matter, good gameplay does, and this has it.  I knew what I was getting when I got BRINK and I wasn't disappointed in the slightest.I remember dreaming of putting call of duty 4's shooting into TF2 as well as wishing that Mirror's Edge-style parkour could be added to many more first-person games.  BRINK made that dream come true and it has been everything I hoped it would be since I bought it on launch for the PS3 so long ago.  Unfortunate things happened to my PS3 and that version of BRINK.  So glad to have it back on steam now.When BRINK came out, the gameplay was focused on solving common problems in FPS games at the time.  It competely succeeded.  For example, grenades can't be spammed randomly to get easy kills, they do lighter damage and knock the target over.  The weapons as well were well-balanced from launch and no gun was obviously dominante like happened in so many shooters and still does.  As for game structure, they use Enemy Territory's fantastic assault-style game mode wherein you accomplish one objective after another.  One team attacks, one team defends in a dichotomy that I prefer over any other game mode.  A feeling of progress, unique perspective for each team, and varied objectives are why this is my favorite game mode.  If only more competitve shooters used this mode (I call it "Assault" mode because of my experience with the original Unreal Tournament)The aesthetic is gorgeous.  Every tattoo you can get, face, everything.  I just love it.  It is a personal taste, yes, but works of art never get old.  It is all about what you love.  There's certainly nothing wrong with the smooth aesthetic that BRINK has.  The hyperealistic style was a great idea, and the customizations are there to make it perfect.  The gun designs, character designs, maps; they all come together beautifully.  BRINK is a lovely game to look at.  I focus on art style over graphical detail yet BRINK has both.The only legitimate complaint that I see with BRINK is that it feels a bit slow.  Not slow as a slug though, so it's easy to manage.  The game is fantastic.EDIT : Forgot to mention that it WILL freeze if you have a weak cpu.  Sometimes when it loads tons of data at once (like on character customization aspects).  Strong computers need not fear.

												My first official steam game, back in 2011 I decided to stop pirating stuff like cs and move onto steam, I thought this game would be a whole lot of fun but it is the first step that is troublesome:+Visuals: Back in 5 years ago this game had great graphics, it was kind of fun to play.+Sound work: Nice OST, nice gun sounds, this part is well done as well.-Gameplay: the game itself is a disaster -the main promised feature, the core of this game - parkour - is total bullsh`t, you can only *jump* and *wall run* in some areas that actually meant to be passed that way, and not all the classes can do that stuff, you know even BATTLEFIELD 3 has that kind of *parkour* and that is just sad -no class balance and rеtаrded AI - you can stay in the middle of the hallway with machine gun shooting in the one point and bots will suicide running towards you. -no map balance - most of the maps are one sided, you need a miracle to win for the weak side, or you enemies should be brain damaged. -boring campaign, If i want to play PvE vs bots I better choose StarWars battlefront, and PVP in this game is non-existent, dead multiplayer + lame campaign.-no steam cardsSo what do we have after all: stillborn game, dead multiplayer, a lot of promises that were never implemented + this game was nearly instantly dead, for the 6 years this game got a maximum discount of 50% ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ this game is bad and abandoned by the devs long time ago. number of helpful: 42 of 72 people (58%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												“Brink takes shooters to a whole new level.”-G4TV“Brink impresses from pretty much every angle.”-Eurogamer“..one of the standout shooters of the year.”-DestructoidLiars, the lot of you!Now that that’s out of my system, I want to thank Brink. It corrected a poor habit of mine while it was still in its infancy.  That habit was blind publisher loyalty.  When I first came across Brink, I wanted to like it.  I really did.  I was immediately interested in its art style, and the Bethesda logo in the corner of the box assured me of its unquestionable quality.  How wrong I was, and how very much I overpaid that day, I cannot stress enough.  As a competitive first-person shooter, Brink has a lot of competition on today’s market, and yet it just feels like the developers haven’t picked one up in the last ten years.  Case in point: Brink sports no campaign to speak of.  The single-player mode, guided by a sheer-thin veneer of a narrative, is just a string of multiplayer maps in which players’ squadmates are A.I.s with about as much tactical sense as a rabid honey badger.   Multiplayer itself is stiflingly limited in terms of map variety, arena size, and weapon options, and many of the maps are rife with arbitrary choke-points that fatally cut down on the pace and entertainment value of gameplay.  Avatar and weapon customization is a welcome feature, and the options available do allow for some unique and inventive character designs, but the decision to require unlocks and temporary in-game purchases for rather basic customization options, like body types, smacks as a bit counter-productive to players finding their niche early on. The total lack of female avatar options at all is equally disappointing.  There are female gamers out there, Splash Damage, and they don’t always want a mountain of armored flesh for an avatar.  Perhaps most disappointing of all, the parkour elements that seem to have been such an integral part of the game’s concept are clunky at best, and a tacked-on gimmick the rest of the time.  Mirror’s Edge this ain’t, as it’s often difficult to tell which surfaces a player can vault over, which ledges one can grab onto, and why one shouldn’t just take cover and use some tactical sense rather than running into the open to charge enemies armed with assault rifles and shotguns.  There’s just no incentive the put it to use the vast majority of the time.  Wrapping up, Brink is visually pretty average.  Personally, I found its art style to be quite inspired and rather reminiscent of the modernistic, tagger-culture influenced, Marc Ecko’s getting up, but that’s just my personal taste, and will not factor into the game’s rating. The score and sound effects are par for the course, but ultimately forgettable, and its mechanics just fall short of their intended mark.  Most damning of all is the fact that there are now multiple free-to-play shooters on the market that outclass Brink in every way.  Blacklight:Retribution, Team Fortress 2, and APB Reloaded, just to name a few, are all superior titles that come with a zero dollar price tag, casting Brink’s sixty-dollar launch-mark in a pretty grim light.  Rating: 4.4Visuals: 5Audio: 5Controls & Mechanics: 5Atmosphere & Experience: 4Entertainment Value: 3For more reviews, articles, and videos, check out LastLevelPress.com!

number of helpful: 12 of 19 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2013
												2011 was a game of big releases, we can all agree on that...Skyrim, Arkham City, Fallout New Vegas DLC's, Portal 2, MW3, Battlefield 3, Gears of War 3, Serious Sam 3, FEAR 3, something that ends with a 3, etc.But no other game, NO OTHER! Got my attention as much as BRINK, BRINK had my highest expectations of 2011, more than skyrim, Arkham City, Portal 2 or any other game.Did it meet the hype? Sadly, no...maybe I hyped it too much, but many people have the same feeling as me.Starting with the graphics, they are not groundbreaking, but not bad either, ok-ish I would say, however it has pretty slow texture pop-ins...The game also feels to be poorly optimized and console ported (you can't lower teh shadows more than normal, and besides that there aren't all that many options besides texture quality and V-Sync. So, if you have a crappy computer, you're screwed!).Moving to the gameplay, it's what somewhat saves the game, your character flows really nicely thanks to SMART (Smooth Movement Across Round Terrain, I think it stands for...) and teamwork is a very important aspect focused in this game, so there wont be any Lone Wolf crap here (I mean there can be if a noob enters, but he will get totally owned...). Sadly, the guns lack punch, only some assault rifles and shotguns and pistols, SMG's feel terrible and they have like a F2P-like handling (watermelon seed shooter).A good thing about the game is the customization: It's enormous, absolutely HUGE! It's impossible for 2 people to have 2 characters look the same. It's very deep! Both the character and weapon customization.The game also features a class based system, assault, medic, etc. There is even the secret ops guy or whatever the name is (which is like the spy from TF2, can sap and hack stuff and disguise as an enemy. Except BRINK, unlike TF2, requires skill...). It's varied and VERY interesting.Audio quality is pretty good, surprisingly (not the guns, btw), your movement, jumping, the effect sounds, etc. All are really well done.Map layout and level design is absolutely phenomenal! It has many twists and encourages tactics, like ascend to higher places or flanking, as it's very team and objective focused!The word of the day for BRINK is definately: Potential! Potential! Potential!Sadly it's just the potential. If Bethesda gets their thumbs off their asses and stop supporting Skyrim and start growing balls and investing in BRINK, I would be very pleased, but more careful, after all, I paid 50 euros for this game to get 80 minutes out of it. -.-But before BRINK 2 or something along those lines, I'm still waiting for FALLOUT 4! HUH?! Oh sorry Bethesda, I forgot it's your money-bath time...Anyways, I wont give a score. get under 9,99€ anything equal or under that is worth it! Beware, this game isn't bad! It's a colossal disappointment, it's different. If the expectation were much lower, this game would be GOOD! But all that hype not met...it's disappointing and it saddens me. A lot...

content:
Posted: September 7, 2014
												I spent so many hours on my PotatoStation 3 playing this game.And, it's still better then CoD:Ghosts.10/10.But no seriously, this game is amazing. I saw it on steam and I said to myself "I remember playing this on PS3, and knowing how much better the experience can be on PC, why not try it?"I was not disappointed, at all. The graphics are pretty decent for this time if you crank 'em up and turn off motion blur.Gameplay is phenomenal, despite the dead community.Audio, fantastic. I love the menu music. Sometimes I'll just sit there and listen to it, no kidding.The story may not be the greatest, but it introduces some original and interesting concepts, such as the ark,etc.Ratings breakdownGraphics: 4/5Gameplay: 4.5/5Audio: 5/5Story: 3.7/5Overall I rate this game 8.6/10, I actually added up my individual ratings above. My only gripe with this game other then the dead community is the story. IT WAS TOO DAMN SHORT. I loved the story, it could be better, yes, but it had potential, like a metric butt ton of it. If they ever release a sequel to this game (which is doubtful) I would buy it. Despite the graveyard of a community this game is still a blast to play offline or with a few friends. This game (In My Opinion) was under rated. This is one of the best FPS games I have ever played and it will be that way for a while.As I said, if you have a couple friends and are looking for something to do, consider picking this up. As a hardcore FPS? Eh, not so much, mainly because of dead community. (Which by now I've said ~5 times).Anyways, thank you for reading my review. Oh, and sorry if there's any spelling errors. Feel free to make fun of me or w/e you do to people who spell stuff wrong.I DO REALIZE MY REVIEW MIGHT BE ALL OVER THE PLACE. I'm sorry, I really am, I tried to organize it the best I could.

content:
Posted: August 6, 2016
												This game is at the brink of extinction.Bad puns aside, The community of this game is currently in the dozens. Get this game, and get your friends to get it.What you're buying is a team based first person shooter consisting of two campaigns with a maximum of 8 PLAYERS cooperatively working on the battlefield with multiple objectives occuring at the same time. If your not interested in the campaign, then there are huge shootouts of balanced teams on the stages (if there's enough people). You've got a variety of customizable weapons with at least two of them suiting your playstyle. A leveling and rank system that rewards more customization options and allows you to use skills that modify your playstyle of the four different classes (With enough skillpoints to usually perfect your favorite two). Challenges to start the game off with so you've got battlefield experience (And the challenges give you weapons, mods and experience so you aren't jumping into multiplayer at level one). A parkour system that if mastered can allow some crazy combos and even hidden collectable lore. Also you can make a ton of characters should you want a different build or just to experiment.If you've read this, just get the game already.

												There is something about brink, the atmosphere, the soundtrack, the look of the world your in.If you have ever stared off into the distance in mirrors edge, you will understand the beauty of this game.The contrast between the resistance and the security’s living areas is crafted perfectly to give you a true sense of the poverty the resistance is fighting to overcome and the wealth the security is trying to protect.Brink feels like its own separate world where you can immerse yourself in either saving or ending the ARK.If you take this game seriously, it will reward you with two great sides to a story and two very different viewpoints on the way money can influence your views.I found it best to play the game alone, against bots (single player mode) to give the best immersion possible.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 19, 2016
												I remember when this game came out it received a lot of hate.  It's online presence these days is practically non-existant it seems.  I think in it's hey-day it would have been significantly better.Most of my experience sadly has been from Singleplayer.as is, the downside is that your team AI is pretty...I wouldn't say dumb as it's just really simple.  If a medic is nearby usually you'll have priority on the revives, I think buffs can be distributed pretty frequently as well.  The problem is that they are almost entirely inept when it comes to level objectives.  When it comes to defending a point or supporting you, they do just fine, however finally pushing to take a point they're just inept.Gameplay wise, yes the parkoure isn't perfect but for it's time I'd say it was pretty solid.  I've scaled objects with relative ease (though there are some issues) wall runs (or springs, Not sure what to call it) are alright, I think the problem is they didn't make it as flashy as other games.You have these typical class systems (assault, medic, engineer etc) which have a somewhat different but not entirely original spin to most games that use the same system have.  What I did like was how they implement a sub-class weight system, but wish they took better advantage of it.I like the the weight class system, basically they restricted weapons to certain weight classes and provided base perks to those classes.  Light weight, are the most mobile but have access to the least amount of weapons;  Heavy, are slow but tough and have access to all weapons in the game (namely the most devastating); and Average build lies somewhere between those two.  It allows you to play a tank-like medic or a nimble one, or a rapid assault character or a heavy assault character.  It's somethin to play with.There's also a perk system for each class, and general perks.  I believe there's a limitation to how many perks you can upgrade so it adds an interesting dynamic to how you build a character to fit your playstyle.I remember people hating on the gunplay in this game, honestly I had no trouble with it.  It's not as accurate as other games of it's time but I believe that was te point.  Speaking as someone who has actully shot guns before I thought it added a degree of realism or challange to shooting that has been lost since the red-dot, point and shoot accuracy made popular by most COD games I played.  I think the real problem is that sometimes enemies feel "spongey" (they soak a lot of bullets).  Attachments are pretty average, red-dot sight, different clip sizes...etc.  Not nearly enough options compared to COD games, and definitely not compared to the ridiculous combinations in Ghost Recon Future Soldier.Character cusomization is pretty neat, The options are somewhat limited but still provide a breadth of diversity.  Don't expect sliders like in Bethesda games, From Software or Korean RPGs.I liked the look of the characters and the levels tell a neat story in and of themselves.  The game's narrative can change somewhat based on your success and failures.  I realy wish there was more of an online presence still but I guess that's what I get for buying it so late after it initially released.TL;DRIf you see this game on sale I think it's worth a pickup, at the time I'm writting this however you're probably too busy playing Overwatch, or some other MP shooter.

content:
Posted: February 29, 2016
												Never usually write reviews but felt i had to because of all the hate this game gets. Originally bought it for Xbox 360 and LOVED it so bought it again for PC.Pros:Some of the best character design I’ve seen in my life, the games art direction is impeccable and so it looks stunning. The character customization is probably the best in an fps game I’ve ever seen with so many awesome different helmets, tattoos etc. (You can even decide your characters voice!) Overall the visuals and aesthetics of this game are near perfect. Intriguing story sets up game nicely and gives it a unique feel although they could have gone more in depth. There are two campaigns from both sides of the conflict and also what if scenario missions so a decent amount of single player content. Shooting mechanics are basic but there is a nice variation in classes and absolutely awesome parkour mechanics.Cons:No one online so the multiplayer is pretty dead, sometimes the AI in single player can be a little dumb but only occasionally. Apart from the story missions there isn't much else to do apart from some challenges (however they do have leader boards).Conclusion:One of my favourite games of all time, I can’t understand why it gates so many bad reviews, with some tweaks to the AI more content and a living multiplayer base this game would be PERFECT.

												 Brink – это мультиплеерный шутер. Разработчики создали интересный мир и персонажей, яркий визуальный стиль, огромное разнообразие настроек внешности персонажей, интересное смешение одиночного и сетевого режимов. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2013
												Brink is all about running around with your team trying to achieve a number of set objectives, which usually involves killing an enemy team on the way. I have a fairly large number of criticisms of this game, the first of which is that there are loads of customisations, yet no female characters. AI isn’t too bad, but the bots on your team are constantly getting in the way. Game-play is very confusing. Not only are the objectives very unclear, but enemies seem to just appear in the worst possible places. You are often staggering  around lost and confused, then you get incapped without knowing where the bullet even came from becaseu an enemy spawned behind you. And enemies seem to be far more difficult to kill than you are! All in all it adds up to a lot of frustration. It’s not a bad game, but it's far from a great game. It has some serious game-play issues. Recommended? Well, At at Sale price, yes, but not at full price.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 29, 2016
												This game has many good things about it...but the problems overpower them. I bought this game to play with my friends (What the store page said I could do) I currently cannot join any of my friends even going so far as to download a program which helps matchmaking (still doesn`t work)I have played Brink for more then enough time to say this Things Brink NEEDS to Work on1. Campain Missions: They`re basically the exact same thing, there`s no change its always just attack this or defend this 2. Matchmaking: If you claim to not only have a fantastic game but have co-op multiplayer in the game then actually do it instead of making people frustrated (make the matchmaking like Team Fortress 2 with no problems) 3. DLC Gun Overpower: I have purchased the DLC and can already see both the Fallout 4 rifle as well as the DOOM submachine gun are very overpowered (DOOM gun does not have any recoil and has the fastest fire rate and the Fallout 4 rifle is the second most damage rifle that you can unlock as a noob)4. Bots: The bots are just basically awful. Playing campain its either your teammates are dumb as logs and don`t help with the main mission and don`t revive you when thier standing right on top of you or the enemies are damn near impossible even on easiest dificulty taking you out in a fraction of a second without you knowing where they are.5. Character Development: When I watched the videos about the character creation I was so excited...only to find out thier all the same. The voice selection as well as the character actually moving his lips with accuracy is amazing yet they all say the same thing with no uniqueness. When you first create your character all you do is make a face, get a voice then get shirts as you play the game. I wish the selection you made on your character could affect how your character handles in combat because no matter what shirt you get (Even the suit for Resistance which is basically a tank) you all mostly have the same health with no difference (Best example of what I`m trying to explain is Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim with each race having benifets as well as armor having benifets). I want to love you Brink because you have all the powers alligned in your favor, please fix these problems and make your game shine.Sincerely- The Professor

content:
Posted: December 1, 2011
												Save or escape the "Ark" you get to choose which side you are on. The campaign is a series of levels that deal with certain things like blowing up a place or stopping a group of guys from blowing up stuff. The game is a must have if you have friends to play with, the co-op modes are alot of fun and alot more easier to play with 2 people. The customization of characters is alot of fun to play with because there is so many different combinations to mess around with. The customization of weapons is great to have that advantage when your in a battle. The  "SMART" (Smooth Movement Across Random Terrain) is awesome and is something that is not seen in games these days, you run and moving smoothly while vaulting over objects which is a fun feature to this game. Time plays a huge factor in every match of Brink, you need to be fast and use strategy to accomplish your goals. The game is great and alot of fun for any FPS player. Just make sure you have friends to play with.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 1, 2014
												I grew up on Doom and Quake, and this harkens back to a time before Call of Duty, back when the mod Team Fortress for Quake was still king. There are issues, balance, ai, gun mechanics, map bottlenecks, all need a little more work. What Brink is good at, though, is making people work together as a team, helping out, and providing a different style of play to a stagnant genre. The Parkour mechanics add a wonderful element to the play, the customization is great, and there was definitely some ambition from the developers. Ultimately, the game is not a success, but it is a gem that I will pull out and admire from time to time and enjoy. If you catch it on a steam sale for <$10, I would check it out, and pass along anything positive in the hopes they can use it to make a better genre overall.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 25, 2014
												I've played this more on my other account. Unfortunately, copy on it is region-locked.This game is multiplayer-based, clearly... I think devs never considered that it'd die out and be played solo mainly. This game blossoms when played with players fighting on both sides - in singleplayer it's more dull, fighting with bots who are equally stupid on your side and on the enemy side, in multiplayer you need people on both sides, otherwise it becomes a babybeating fest of a game, as bots can't do anything against a squad of players. If you have friends who are willing to play with you, get this now. It's worth it......however if you are on your own prepare for frustration with the stupidity of your bots, dull fights with the enemy bots and the nigh-incompletable challenge that is required to unlock all the guns and attachments, talking about tier 2 and 3 of "Be More Objective". The aimbot-like accuracy of enemy bots and concentrated fire, lack of aim on the side of bots that are "helping" you and  the fact that you get blasted away in mere moments, AND you are the only person completing the objectives in rather short amount of time are already enough to smash your keyboard.Sad this thing died. It's so reliant on players that without them you suddenly realize it frustrates you more often than it makes you have fun.Still, I'd recommend it.It was good.Rest in peace, Brink.

												A fun multiplayer shooter with a good amount of story to expand its appeal. Combat mechanics are great and customization of characters and weapons is one of the best within this genre of games. With that said, it also has the feel as a partially completed game. The previously mentioned story is short and not exactly climatic, character customization is limited to only male characters, and the AI are either really easy to beat or extremely difficult. A personal favorite to play when bored or just looking for a challenging AI arena shooter. Should have delayed the release and kept working to make this better.

number of helpful: 11 of 21 people (52%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 9, 2013
												Background: I'm a FPS fan, I enjoy some similar game play types such as Unreal Tournaments Assault.  This particular game didn't click with me.I played this game in early 2013 as part of a personal challenge to play some games on my backlog.  Naturally I had to play SP with bots as the MP community had mainly moved onto other things years ago.  Also as your have to "level up" I didn't want to start as a noob with rude people who would be telling me I was doing it wrong.  The levels are quite fun at first, you can pick what type of  character to play, follow the other bots to an objective and either earn it, or death zerg until success.  Be prepared to hear about capturing or losing command points a hell of a lot.  You could be about to win the level, then the enemy AI take one of your command points and the AI on your team decide to go get their revenge.The movement to the game is kinda fun, but really its just a gimmick.  In battle you'll either kill the guy or get killed, its not about fancy movement and gunplay at the same time.The game has 2 sides, each map lets you play the story from either side, but really, does anyone care what the story is about, why the are getting wound up?  The third time you have heard the bots talking about "WE HAVE TAKEN THEIR COMMAND POST" you have forgotten what or why you were doing.  You just know you have to get closer and press and action key to win the objective.Overall the game wasn't fun enough.  Apart from going back to get some more achievements I won't be going back to this.Things that annoy me:I don't want a choice of voice actorsOne of the maps was impossible to win at the normal difficulty.  Partly as the bots never teamed up with me. I dropped the difficulty and got through the map flawlessly.Lots of focus on things that I'm just not interested in.The bots dialogueThe bots, both friendly and enemy are the main reason you'll want to quit.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I've previously owned this game before on PS3, so I decided to give the game another chance on PC. Personally, I like the artstyle, its fairly unique and sets the game apart from other run of the mill shooters. Although it is what you'd expect, everything for the resistance is improvised and gritty, everything for the security forces is shiny, white and looks brand new, etc. The soundtrack is also decent, the main menu theme is currently stuck in my head as I write this review. The gameplay is class based, the game requires a large degree of teamwork to accomplish any of the objectives, this isn't really a game where you can be the lone wolf and decimate everything in your path. Anyone familiar with games such as TF2 or star wars battlefront, will feel right at home with the gameplay. The only aspect of the gameplay I don't like is the parkour, its very jerky, sometimes unresponsive, and difficult to pull off in certain situations due to the 1st person view limiting your perspective of the surrounding environment, it feels like the parkour was an afterthought and was wedged in at the last minute in order to attract the Mirrors Edge crowd. However, I've found that parkour isn't particularly usefull in all the missions anyway, so the clunkyness isn't really a problem as I rarely used parkour to its full extent.Character customisation is rather good. By leveling up you unlock different outfits for your character, allowing you to personalise him as you see fit. Anyone wishing to play as a female character may be slightly dissapointed as you can only play as a male character. You can however choose from three different body types, Light, medium and heavy. all with their own advantages and drawbacks. e.g Light characters can run very fast but can be killed in only a few hits, wheras the heavy characters take more damage, but move slower. There are also perks and abilities for each class, with the Medic being able to upgrade his healing abilities, the engineer can gain a sentry gun upgrade, the soldier can dispense more ammo to comrades and the operative can genrally become more sneaky. More weapons and attachments for said weapons can be unlocked through the completion of individual challenges, separate from the main game. Most of these challenges are fairly easy, and don't require a great deal of effort, allowing you to unlock all the weapons and attachments somewhat quickly. The game has a wide variety of weapons to choose from, allowing for a good variety of playstyles. Sadly, the multiplayer is fairly dead. Whenever I try to search for a match, there's no one else playing. This means you're left with the single player mode. However, those familiar with Star Wars battlefront's 'instant action' feature, will feel right at home as the 'free play' mode allows you to jump into any mission of your choosing, and apply custom mutators to that mission. Unfortuntely, the AI is not the best feature of this game as it is very temperamental. Sometimes the friendly AI will be as stupid as a sack of hammers and at others it will be flawless, the same can be said for the enemy AI, sometimes it wrecks you and your team, sometimes it just sits back and takes whatever beating you're giving it. In conclusion, the game is fairly solid but is held back by the lack of an active multiplayer scene, the temperamental AI and the clunky parkour.

content:
Posted: December 12, 2011
												Brink was badly rated, hated and put away in a rush. People judged it too early, way before any patches got released - they didn't give it a chance because of the technical hiccups. I admit the AI was bad at the release date... but who wants to play with bots in a game that was made for multiplayer matches with humans? Also, there is the choppy gameplay problem  - but only if you play locally. Once you connect to a dedicated server (you can even do it on your own PC), the gameplay turns as fluid as it should be. I think this game has one of the best character customization systems in the FPS gaming industry. The gameplay is similar to ET:QW; minus vehicles, plus vaulting. The art has to be mentioned too: characters; weapon design; colors; maps; atmosphere; sounds; music - everything about it is unique and top notch quality. I think this game was neglected because the majority of the players are too arrogant if they are confronted with technical issues... Anyway, this game is neat! :)

content:
Posted: August 14, 2011
												There is nothing in Brink that hasn't already been done. The parkour controls, objective focused combat and class specific levels system are all game devices that have been tried and tested. In many instances, Brink even fails to make better of older, cheaper games that offer such features in their games. It doesn't help either that the game's presentation is poor. Brink's interface is clumsy and confusing, the engine is seven years out of date and it is too demanding for what little visual dexterity is presented. Still, Brink is somewhat enjoyable. If you're familiar with Quake Wars or Return to Castle Wolfenstein's multiplayer, the gameplay will make you feel right at home with weapons providing the same kick and combat moving as fluid as it did with both games. However by contrast, the maps are bland - not really having any appeal at all unless corridors and stairways gravitate towards your interest. Brink's difficult to recommend overall unless on discount.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Brink is a parkour, class based, FPS with story that let's you customize your weapons to your specifications.  The following classes description was taken from wiki:  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brink_%28video_game%291.  Soldiers: Soldiers are primarily concerned with destroying important objects with explosives. They are also in charge of resupplying their teammates with ammo. Soldiers can also throw damaging speciality grenades, such as molotov cocktails, flashbang, and plant satchel charges similar to C4. With the proper ability equipped and utilised (Scavenger), they are the only class that have access to a potentially unlimited supply of ammunition.2.  Engineers: The Engineer is concerned primarily with building, repairing, and upgrading things on the battlefield. Engineers must also disarm enemy explosives planted by soldiers as well as enemy landmines. He can also upgrade his and his teammate's weapons to do more damage, upgrade teammates' body armour, and plant hidden landmines.3.  Medics: Medics revive downed teammates and buff their teammates' health. They also have special health buffs they can dispense to their teammates, such as improving their teammates' metabolism (how fast they heal on the battlefield) or temporarily boosting their sprint speed. They are the only class that can buff their own health or self-resurrect themselves when downed.4.  Operatives: Operatives are the spies of Brink. They can hack computers to complete certain Mission Objectives and can also disguise themselves as the enemy. They are the only class that can spot hidden landmines.The game was pretty damn good, but by now the games online would probably be dead.  So beware when purchasing.  Everyone working as a team was fantastic and fun.  The parkour is exactly as it sounds.  You do a lot of jumping here and sliding there.  Think Titanfall if you've played that, but without the jetpacks.  Customization is cool in which you unlock certain attachments and upgrades for your weapons and how you characters look.  Similar to how Call of Duty does it, but Brink's user interface makes it look all pretty and the 3D models of weapons stands out.Interesting, fun and well worth checking out.  It does have a story and simi-single player.  Drop in Drop out coop online, but chances are you'll be playing by yourself unless you have some friends willing to play with you.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												A new Game-experience...If you play the most known games like Counterstrike, Call of duty, Crysis... then you will find here a fresh new style. The Trailer is really catchy (to be honest: it was the reason why i thought about buying). This is not a game you can play every day, but a nice variety to everything you know before.Mentionable points+ New and own game style, easy to learn+ Climb over machines, containers... use the direct way to the target-  MP Servers are mostly down__________________________Graphics - 7/10 The graphics seems rough and bit edged, but this is also the style of the game. It is basicly nice done.Sound - 7/10Sound is ok. nothing special.AI - 8/10The Bots are average-good programmed. Less to none buggy behavour.Ingame enviroment possibilities - 9/10The best possibility is here that you can nearly climb over everything - depending on your body-type. If you choose to play light-body character you can run, slilde on the floor... why using the path? climb the container and take the direct way. really.... nice done. complexity 7/10It takes a few minutes until you understand how to use everything. how you make xp the best way, how to change character... but its not too bad.Single Player 4/10There is no real SP Story line. The SP and the MP are nearly the same, because you play the same maps. you can choose to do it in random order or in a "story-campagne-way" Multiplayer 5/10Playing MP is fun but there are most of the time problems when you open a server. For example others cant connect because an option was missing or connection problems,.....The public servers by the developers are down also.The only way to play MP online is now either to connect to a serve from history-list or to open a LAN server via Tunngle.Price 3/10 Since you can buy this game nearly everywhere for round about 5,- EUR, The 20,- EUR here are too much.In my opinion 5,- EUR would be okay, since the dlc's are nice: 10,- EUR for the complete-pack would be a good deal. Personal SummaryEven with the DLC, there are round about 20 Maps you can play. Not bad but also not really much. The main thing that keeps the fun factor up in this game is that you have many possibilitys to turn the table around during the fight. Most of them need to be unlocked (which keeps you playing also). For example: Enemys keep killing your teammates and you cant reach them (as medic) without getting killed? Equip the "medic-grenade" and revive many (!) of them at the same time from cover.Enemys are too many? Equip "mechanic" character, boost your own weapons and your teammates' and also build sentry guns and mines.Enemys come from everywhere and catch you? Equip "Spy" Character, get the Identity from a dead enemy and you will look like him and appear as a "friendly" on your enemys radar. Then go behind enemy lines and kill him with an "suprise" from behind. You can also "hack" (as a spy) enemy sentry guns so they attack THEM or put remote control on them to control them manual ^^and so on....

Brink.It's pretty, and like TF2 with actual class-specific objectives and places you can't go if you picked the wrong character model, but just as you get warmed up it's over.Single player's too short with bots that don't really challenge you.Co-op can be worthwhile, but even shorter.Multiplayer is pretty sparse.I guess that if they knock the price down to the point where you're only paying for one of the game modes, it'll be ok.It was going to be the biggest thing ever, it was going to be legendary, it was going to... work.Sadly it was a buggy mess on release, leaving a wave of players who'd paid full price (or even worse, pre-ordered) with a list of valid complaints. As the first wave largely abandoned the servers for TF2 the price was halved and the new blood came looking for a decent budget fps. Which it is, to be fair.Now it's a decent budget shooter with an interesting parkour mechanic for getting around the maps in new ways. but it's still not worth the price.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2013
												A class based FPS much like Battlefield focused on completing objectives and parkour movement. There's no point in recommending this now - the player base is minimal and there are tons of other shooters with more players. Thankfully, there is a sort of campaign, but fighting bots doesn' feel fun or rewarding and they aren't terrible, but not a good enough test aginst human players. I'm not sure I'm fond of the way the guns feel either, though I can't describe why. Unless you're DESPERATE for a parkour based shooter, don't waste your time or money - the <10 servers are only occassionally not empty.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2016
												As unplayed as the game is, I have to give it a good review. Even if the trailers didn't show what the game actually is, and even if the story is inconsistant, in the end this is a game. A team objective based game with 4 different classes, each with powerups and abilities that could change the flow of a round.You have the following:- Engineers: able to place mines, buff their or their teammates' weapons, place sentries and so on- Operatives: capable to disguise as enemies and hack mines- Soldiers: able to resupply their or team's ammunition- Medics: health buffs and reviving downed teammatesThe game also offers three body types: heavy, medium and light. Each body type has a weight limit when it comes to weaponry, Heavies being able to take any weapon as primary and secondaries reaching up to AR'sThink about how many builds can you work around with.Weapon Mods are also obtainable from challanges that can get harder as you go through them.Maps might seem overly simple and few, but they offer enough cover spots and good spawns and command post positions.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2013
												Бринк. Игра меня впечатлила. Сюжет есть: Защитникам острова защитить остров, а русскому сопротивлению собственно уничтожить остров и сбежать с него. Как ни странно, при хорошем сюжете эта игра сетевая по большей части. Графика более, чем хорошая, краски тоже, как и звуки. Много разных видов оружий, способностей и костюмов. Существуют 3 типа телосложения: Плотный, обычный и худой. Плотный тип телосложения таскает пулемёты, всё тяжелое, у него много здоровья. Может забираться на выступы, которые ему по пояс. Обычный тип обладает меньшим запасом здоровья, на может забираться на выступы с его высотой. Худой же тип самый слабый в здоровье и оружии, но он очень быстро бегает, не устаёт, забирается везде и на всё, так как умеет отпрыгивать от стен, забираться по ним и вытворять акробатические приёмы. Оценка хорошая (8/10).

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 1, 2014
												About the controversy around this game...It was terrible on launch, with loads of performance issues and glitches, but was patched after a few months (runs well for me). Unfortunately, by then, everyone had stopped playing. The current state of the game is that there are only a few servers and only a few players. Despite this, I would still recommend this game but only if you have some friends to play coop with as public servers are very, very empty (at least last time I checked).About the game...It's class based team games, with a variety of objectives and freedom to help your team in a number of ways. Great art style and graphics. The environments look great, but aren't as open as they should be to take advantage of the parkour mechanics. The singleplayer is basically just a botmatch, so I would stick to coop and multiplayer. The main flaw for me was that you are likely to distribute all your skills to one class so that you are very powerful, which dissuades you from switching class to help the team when you need an engineer to blow something up or an operative to hack, etc.

												HIGHLY UNDERRATED GAME.  The customization and gameplay is both addictive and unique.  It's a mission based fps where you pick to be the rebels trying to leave the city or the officers upholding the law to keep everyone in. number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 6, 2014
												One of the WORST FPS I have EVER played. I seriously regret this $10 purchase, I wouldn't pay $1 to play it. Absolutely horrible and unplayable. Glitchy graphics, team AI is unintelligent and usless with unbalanced gameplay. Only good things are  maybe some of the concepts in the game, story is okay but that isn't enough to make it worth playing. Extremely disapointing game from Bethesda. Mind you I have only played solo. The game might be better played with others but even then I am certain there a better games out there with less issues. I have also heard most of the servers are dead so multiplayer is  for the most part a no go. If they fixed the solo campaigne so it was possible to progress and not waste 20-40min per mission because your own team mates are so useless, this could of been a great game, but It is just horrible. I don't play games to do the same thing over and over, and over, and over, and over... I don't just play for the sake of playing a game, I want to be able to progress. I think it was designed to be MP only, as the single player is just unpleasant and unplayable. They shouldn't of even bothered with a single player mode. While some of the customization is cool, it sill all seems more or less the same and the faces, while funny, are unappealing. The parkour is cool, when it works. this game is not worth the frustration. Over all, the game looks cool, not worth it if you want to play solo, and I am not even sure multiplayer is all that active. buy at youer own risk, do not pay full price.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												My God. What have I done?To clarify: I jumped so hard on this bandwagon I'm surprised the wheels didn't come off. The free-running, the different body types, the whole idea of either siding with the guys trying to keep the fallen paradise in one piece or with the others who truly believed that there was hoarding going on that should be shared by all and scarcity was being made up. The ability to change your class mid-match to fill in what was needed.I even put together a cosplay of The Anger. That's just not something I randomly do, but I felt like this game was going to set the world on fire. Oh, it did. Like a bag of flaming turds left on someone's astroturf, catching their trailer ablaze, and the trailer next door, and so on until the whole park was an inferno. The matches grew stale, the lack of good AI made it so players who didn't fit on one of the Human teams didn't have a prayer, and no dedicated servers from the creators made for a wasteland shortly after launch.So here I am, wondering what I had done, blindly following a game, becoming a day-one adopter, only to stare into the abyss of a trailer park fire burning away the glee I felt when I started seeing previews of this game with all the heat of a thousand angry suns. You went from being the chosen one to the jerkface who killed all the younglings.May you pass from all memory.

number of helpful: 11 of 22 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2014
												Possibly the worst game I preordered. Overall the game is not even THAT bad but it just doesn't excel on any level. One of the reasons i preorderd this game was because of character customisation. Although it has more customisation than most first person shooters these days, the game is just too fast to see any real difference between characters other then they're white or black, something the Unreal Tournament series always succeeded in. Obviously, I did not buy the game just for the character customisation. I also bough the game because it should have great gameplay and there apparently was a story mode. While there is a story mode, I don't think anyone really cared about the story unlike in games like Left 4 Dead but it was a nice attempt to implant some sort of story mode. The gameplay is OK, just your typical shooter but somehow, to me it just didn't feel right for a FPS. There are also objectives your team needs to complete in every mission, which could be great but everything is just too chaotic and you have no idea what to do.Brink isn't a bad game but there's a reason why players stopped playing the game. You probably won't find people playing so it's you vs bots. The only way this game could get alive is if they gave it away for free.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
												This game is what I think of when I think of shooters done poorly. It does very little of what it attempts properly, the level design, and mission objectives are monotonous. Just like EA and its business practices.The gunplay is so-so, with a decent level of guns, and customizability. However, I found the mods to be bleh, at best. They affect your gun a little bit but very little notice is taken from them most of the time. It's an average shooter that brings little in the way of gunplay that's new. Just like EA, they fail to innovate in any capable manner.The running and jumping off walls, free running thing. Not done very well, in fact once I got online I saw maybe 3 people do it with even mixed success. It's like a Mirror's Edge knockoff that went south in a jiffy. EA may be to blame... they usually are. Wow now for the real killer that made me get a whopping 32 hours from this game. The level and objective design. First the levels are not balanced in any remote sense of the word. Every FPS has those levels, but every level has a high degree of balance issues in this game. Then to top the cherry off on the cake, the game modes all revolve around this King of the Hill type of design. That “Hold this point you’re our last hope” kinda thing. Which it doesn’t even deliver on the potential of the game mode. Epic shoot-outs between lines are not what you find. Mayhem and chaos are all that await you. Just like every time you buy an EA game and allow them to create more terrible abominations.So the most important things are: 1.) Don’t buy EA games, they’re a cancer. -and- 2.) Find a better game to play that’s an FPS, if you’re gonna be a hate-monger and buy EA even they have better choices out there.

content:
Posted: May 19, 2011
												While the professional reviews for this game are a bit harsh, I'm still having fun with it so far. Sure, it's not the game it could've been, but it's definitely not as bad as the reviews want you to believe. The graphics are a bit dated, but they're stylish nonetheless. And the gameplay is a solid mix of Team Fortress, Counter-Strike, Call Of Duty and other popular shooters. The only downside is that there just doesn't seem to be any decent balancing on certain maps. Sometimes you're stuck in the spawn zone for the entire match, and there's no way to get out. Things like that really take the fun out of the game. That, and a few bugs (like no sound at all on certain maps). There is still a lot of fun to be had here, so if you like multiplayer games you might want to give it a spin :)[Rating: 77/100]

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												One of my most disappointing purchases. The game promised to be something different, introducing what was supposed to be fluid movement via a "parkour" style. I had this game pre-purchased on the promises delivered by the trailers, and I wish I had saved my money. The "Parkour" part was not well-executed, and seemed to be "laggy" on every server I played. Want to get away from the lag and play with bots instead? Expect to have to do every single objective by yourself, because the bots aren't programmed to do it. But Brink's most disappointing feature is that it's just....boring. A game about parkour gunplay should not be boring. It takes half of your clip of ammo to down an enemy, and even when they're down, they're not dead yet. You'll essentially have to use a full clip of ammo whenever you want someone to really, truly die.
