Hell, there isn't even a picture.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												Brink is what happens when you try to make a multiplayer FPS game that promotes movement and fast-paced action but feel constrained by the modern trends of "tactical" play and cover mechanics. Simply put, it falls flat in every way imagineable.It's disappointing because I was really excited for this game when I first heard about it. I thought it might actually be the next best thing since Unreal Tournament 2004. "Finally, a new competitive shooter that encourages movement." But nope. In fact, most of the time, you get more points for being near an objective and just standing there. That's already a bad sign for a game that supposedly encourages you to run around, climb, and jump off walls whenever possible, but if the guns didn't all feel like pea shooters it'd at least be tolerable.One thing I'll give this game credit for is that it doesn't keep track of your kill/death ratio. It's all about the objective here. All about the teamwork. But even then, as mentioned earlier, you'll find that the easiest way to play this game is sitting still and shooting at people running by. It's not inherently a bad thing if a shooter isn't pure run and gun, but when a game puts a lot of emphasis on its parkour system, I certainly expect some faster-paced action.Even if you somehow find a way to enjoy this kind of gameplay, the horrible optimization will completely kill off any desire to keep playing it. If you use an ATI graphics card, you better pray to the gaming gods that your game won't run at less than 10 fps for no reason at all. And THEN if you happen to enjoy it and can run it well, you'll be disappointed to see that the game is pretty much empty online. It died off that quickly.Short version: Don't get this game. You won't find anything worthwhile here.

content:
Posted: May 11, 2015
												I'm writing this as someone who'd enjoy this at its prime on the Xbox.This game had a lot of desirable elements that hadn't been seen in a lot of other shooters at the time. Yet, it still felt like a condensed version of TF2 prior to the customization. But that made it interesting. The classes by name were there, but a lot of the elements mixed together in a clunky and sometimes enjoyable game.Like the medic aspect, it could be paired with a spy-like ability and a scout-like speed. All good on there own, all pretty hard to work with when melded together.Would I recommend this game? Hella. If only on sale and under $5. The game has a linear campaign that repeats in a multiplayer format, which means that multiplayer to this game was almost a requirement. Within a month of buying this game, the active players number was almost gone already, and it was a bot vs bot game, which was just a merciless frustration. Buy this game and bring friends, a lot of em'. Honestly, if this game were just introduced again on a different face, it'd probably do well. It's an experience, the guns, the characters, even the movement style. But the lack of players and clunky class unity, (among other things) rightfully brought it a quick demise. I'd love to see this go F2P, because it'd pull in a lot of players and revive the servers for a short while. It has a lot of good in it, but not enough interest to inspire a renovation worthy enough of bringing it back.Buy it cheap, play with friends. Avoid bots.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
												Thing is, launch killed this game.  It failed on an epic level and Splash damage couldn't recover to fix the bugs and errors fast enough.  I feel bad for them cause years later, I still open this up and play vs the bots and have a fun time.  To me the asthetic is a vibrant and wonderful change from the drab CoD# and BF# games.  Guns and gameplay feel good too.  Playing alone is a real limitation of a game that seemed ready to have it all, but its all there is.  I really feel this is a game that inspired the fun and dynamic movement we see in games like Destiny today.  Despite the utter disappointment I felt after pre-ordering this so long ago, I still think that since I play it now and then, I got my money's worth.  Thanks for pushing the envelope Splash Damage and I'm sorry for what happened.Since its a dead game, I only recommend for cheap or to play via lan (if ppl still do that) :)

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 28, 2014
												A game that had a lot of potential and completely failed to deliver.The Good:-Conceptually, it's very cool.  It was obviously designed from the ground up to be a different team FPS experience, and it had a lot of potential.-The graphics are clean and stylized.The Bad:-A totally lackluster singleplayer experience.  No campaign worth mentioning, it's just multiplayer with bots.-For all the talk of classes, roles, and cooperation, ultimately every class kind of feels the same in a firefight.-When the community died, the game died.  It has no replay value if your friends aren't logging in.-Controls are iffy.Don't bother with it unless you have a sizeable group of friends who play.  Even then, try to convince them to get something else.  Maybe TF2, if you don't mind the hats.

content:
Posted: August 22, 2016
												i have mixed feelings for this game..mostly negative feelings for this game. you start off as either a security officer as part of ark security to secure and save the ark, or you play as a washed up trigger happy "terrorists" the security calls them to escape the ark. you start out mostly underpowered while everything else is a bit stronger. and bots are rather anoying when one guns you down..sits at a corner where obviously oblivious medics rush in to heal to be gunned down right in front of you, your only choice is to respawn. gameplay is pretty bad..thanks to the AI now for bonuses its rather bad that you have to do EVERYTHING and when i say everything i meen "hack this,destroy that, escort a droid to the drop of, intercept a hostage escort, etc" and the bots are practicly brain dead in terms of helping you, as they sometimes run into the enemy and shoot at anything or everything or nothing at all (that sort of thing) especially when it comes to those "training" missions were you can do level apon levels to get ingame gear that can help you in the campain. i have no hopes for this game in the possible future of it EVER having a sequel.

												I'll be honest this game is buggy and dead buuuuuut it's still fun. Though many people seem more content with Dirty Bomb a case can be made that it's a step back. Tactical positioning that can be implemented fairly quickly with SMART can be the difference between a quick loss or fast death. This is leaving out the sheer amount of customization that allows you to create classes out of the base 4 and to your liking as well. Pick the game up if you can, on sale if you can get it, but definately pick it up. Tactical action of the early Battlefield games with the high octane running and gunning of Quake and my personal favorite FPS.

content:
Posted: July 27, 2015
												Brink is an "eh" game.  The multiplayer scene is dead.  I haven't been able to find a server with a ping below 100 at all, so don't go into it looking for awesome online play.  The bots themselves are kinda dumb, which means you end up having to do most of the work yourself.  The parkour aspect is actually pretty minimal, at least the way I've played, and you have to unlock the "light" body type that's most capable of parkour anyway (but which is the weakest body type).  Honestly, it's just another underwhelming idTech game that I got as part of a bundle.  I don't recommend it.  It's nothing special for single player.

content:
Posted: March 29, 2013
												Ковчег являлся частью современной экологической концепции, примером самодостаточного местообитания. Огромный плавучий город, созданный людьми, стал прибежищем учёных и мыслителей, которые хотели реализовать эту экологическую концепцию, а богатые руководители города предоставили им для этого поистине курортные условия.Но угроза глобальной экологической катастрофы вскоре стала реальнее некуда: таяли ледники, поднимался уровень моря, и выживание самого человечества оказалось под вопросом. Многие тысячи людей со всего земного шара бросились на Ковчег в поисках спасения. Беженцы всеми силами старались выжить, а отцы-основатели города и их потомки пытались во что бы то ни стало сохранить над ним контроль.Теперь Ковчег утратил все связи с тем, что осталось от суши, и находится в полной изоляции. Предположительно возобновляемые ресурсы Ковчега истощаются, и есть риск того, что власть сменится, и противостоящие социальные группы вступят в кровопролитный конфликт.Напряжение растёт, а Охрана и Сопротивление ведут бой за власть над Ковчегом. Чью сторону примете вы?

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2016
												Brink has a lot of potential, but has not even come close to matching it yet. I'll list a few points that you should really consider before buying it.The Bad:-ATI Support, you WILL not experience good framerates with an ATI card unless you have very old drivers.-There is a known glitch that sound cuts out, thats right, you will have NO sound.-Graphics, they look muddled, not great-Movement is sluggish and even glitchy at times-Heavy guns are underpowered, I don't see heavy classes played very often due to this.-Engineer/Medic are going to be far more played than Soldier, and WAY more than the Op (which really sucks imo)-Virtually no in-game stats, at the end of a match you don't even know how well you technically did beyond points and "awards"The Good:-Plenty of guns, plenty of different attachments for most guns-Lots of different combinations for customization, so your guy can look relatively different-Teamplay focused gameIt has lots of potential, but honestly the bugs are literally so bad that I get annoyed after playing for a few hours...

Posted: August 24, 2012
												Pretty balanced weaponry/gadgets and easy to use SMART system which is used for hopping walls, sliding, etc and requires teamwork with the use of 4 classes similar to Team Fortress 2(Soldier, Medic, Engineer, Operative) to win. The story is basic  with 2 factions opposing each other though neither are shown to be "evil" and can be played with 7 other players. Its adversarial modes and customization are where Brink shines with players able to change the appearance of his/her character(s), customize his/her weapons with multiple attachments which both are unlocked through completion of obstacle courses, and level up to unlock many abilities in each class catagory. Overall Brink is a decent game and is fun to play with/against others.

content:
Posted: March 29, 2013
												Ковчег являлся частью современной экологической концепции, примером самодостаточного местообитания. Огромный плавучий город, созданный людьми, стал прибежищем учёных и мыслителей, которые хотели реализовать эту экологическую концепцию, а богатые руководители города предоставили им для этого поистине курортные условия.Но угроза глобальной экологической катастрофы вскоре стала реальнее некуда: таяли ледники, поднимался уровень моря, и выживание самого человечества оказалось под вопросом. Многие тысячи людей со всего земного шара бросились на Ковчег в поисках спасения. Беженцы всеми силами старались выжить, а отцы-основатели города и их потомки пытались во что бы то ни стало сохранить над ним контроль.Теперь Ковчег утратил все связи с тем, что осталось от суши, и находится в полной изоляции. Предположительно возобновляемые ресурсы Ковчега истощаются, и есть риск того, что власть сменится, и противостоящие социальные группы вступят в кровопролитный конфликт.Напряжение растёт, а Охрана и Сопротивление ведут бой за власть над Ковчегом. Чью сторону примете вы?

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												Brink is an epic first person shooter that should not be missed by anyone. Ignore the other comments that people make about this, because this is a true masterpiece.The combat in this game feels solid and the AIs are of a reasonable difficulty, and the three difficulty levels make the game accessible for all gamers. Getting kills feels very satisfying and rewarding in this game, and you can even see the XP roll in as you deal damage.The gameplay in Brink is excellent and provides fun each time you play. The game is very clear with regards to the in-game objectives, as there is an 'objective wheel' which directs you towards each objective.In addition, the graphics in Brink are very good for the time and have features such as anti-aliasing and aniostropic filtering. The graphics engine used in Brink is very well optimised for the PC, so the game will run on most modern PCs.However, the primary objective can sometimes switch quickly and suddenly, which can make you a bit confused with where you need to be.Overall, Brink is an outstanding game and deserves much more respect than it gets, so I am giving it an official grade of A*.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
												This is a game, that, unlike a lot of greenlight games, doesn't deserve punishment for low effort.  Why, then, is Brink a bad product?  Because it's the perfect product to show off everything that's BAD about the new era of online gaming.   A huge amount of effort went into look, feel, quality, construction.   But they did just enough to achieve that, and ignored all gameplay, but they hit you hard and fast with demands for DLC purchases.   It could have been a contender.  But it's everything that's bad about the microtransaction era and nothing that's good about it.   We have a lot to learn from this failure.Technical:  No support for 4K earns an immediate thumbs down when your strategy is to release a high graphics cutting edge game.   It's smooth and fluid enough, but optimisation could be better.  Graphics:  They hired artists and put in a huge amount of effort refining the look and feel of the game, as well as hiring great voice actors, so you would think this is thumbs up territory.   This is why we have so much to learn from this game.Gameplay: Now here's where it gets controversial.   It's a mediocre arena shooter (like there aren't hundreds of these) with a fairly well done art style and even a plotty single player campaign.   But the single player is just the mediocre arena shooter with mediocre bots.   But balanced around PvP, badly.   No effort was put into gameplay balance.  No effort was put into refining this after the massive amount of effort put into polishing the game.  There's actually a single player storyline that might be quite interesting if it wasn't for the horrendous miscarriage that is the gameplay.All the effort in this game went into polish and DLC options, and none of it into the heart and soul of gameplay.  They give you no doubts when it comes to making sure you know they want your money.  But for what?  There's far better free arena FPS games.  Final note:  At this stage it's 4 years after launch, and the online servers are abandoned.  Even if you wanted to pay money to have a worse experience than the free arena shooters, you can't because there's not enough players.   They still want $10 for the full package though.   Go buy $10 worth of donuts and play TF2, you'll have a much better time.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												Poor gameplay, terrible weapon handling, bugs everywhere, animation problems, poor netcode, poor singleplayer/multiplayer campaign, mindless bots, crap level designs, poor developer support (studio did not get enough funding and was prevented from releaseing their final weapon balance patch which would've made the game better), no mods/custom games, the parkour (one of the games main selling features) often didn't work properly and you got teleported all over the place cause of the poor netcode and had to fight with it to climb up anywhere, DLC that segments the playerbase before the game was even established.This is one of my regretted pre-orders that a friend got me interested in and I bought into the hype watching the game being played on youtube. I feel like Titanfall is going to be like a much improved version of BRINK.

If you want to risk it, go for it.

Posted: September 3, 2014
												I really do not see people's issues with this game. Its two great stories centered on a conflict both sides are making for themselves. You watch as the distopia of the ark crumbles into a war simply because the Security and their bosses wont tell the common people that the world outside the ark is in brutal, unrelenting, choas.  And the Common people are not telling the higher up the stuff the Ark is made of is Dying. If you own this game Give it a second chance, pay attention to everything. If you are thinking of buying it do it while it is on sale. The game is far from perfect, but it has nice tight controls and great customization. This game is far better than people give it credit for.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												BRINK in a nutshell. Look at a gun! *game crashes*. Play a mission! *game crashes*. Do anything but customize your character, pick the weapons you want, and wonder why you bought this game since you already watched about 2 videos that said it was a PAIN to get it running, and knowing that you don't know how to do anything to fix the game, you buy it anyways, and never get it to run right.. *GASP* Okay... I'm going a bit too far here, it was my fault i bought this, but, if you don't know how to install all the patches you need to RUN brink, then don't buy it. No matter how much you try to get it to run without the patches, it wont work, trust me, all the time I spent on this game was retrying the missions waiting for one to actually go to the loading sequence and NOT freeze up and crash.BTW, anyone who thinks I'm over-reacting, just say so, I'm not the arguing type of person.

I played Enemy Territory competetively back in the day and always meant to pick up Brink, but got busy with other things and didn't want to get wrapped up in another multiplayer game at the time. Now that I've put some time into it I'm wondering what went wrong? It's a damn solid game... the few online games I managed to get into were extremely fun and there's a level of quality here that has really held up well over the last few years.In my opinion, Brink is one of those underestimated gems that could really benefit from the (yes, I know) free-to-play business model. A lot of people are probably hesitant to drop $20 on it, considering it rarely goes on sale- so they will never know how good it actually is. There's a ton of visual customization upgrades already built into the game, they should honestly just slap price tags on those and re-release Brink as F2P.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 2, 2013
												Brink is your standard establishment versus rebels (government v terrorists) FPS story arc. The game itself has a relatively weak story, told mostly by a 1-2 minute cutscene before each mission, first narrated by your commander giving objectives, then from the perspective of the soldiers. This game definitely didn't invest heavily in the campaign as it is basically a series of objective missions with AI, which means having a friend is definitely a plus as the missions become much more enjoyable when playing with friends. Even with this, the game takes less than 7 hours to clear 100% meaning low return on your funds. The gameplay offers combat most similar to Killzone 2, there is a class system and there are weapons useable across classes but they have their trade offs, and there is a unique feature of this game which is the parkour system (freerunning). The classes follow the Killzone style, with the soldier, sabateur, engineer, and medic which offer some class abilities which differentiate them from one another. Furthermore there is weapon customization like call of duty where you can modify your weapons with attachments, the good news is most of the attachments are easy to get, thus most people are on a level playing field. The leveling of characters unlocks more abilities and makes the character's more diverse, the classes are relatively balanced although personally the medic seems to be one of the stronger classes minus his inability to perform objectives (which is what all gamemodes are around). The parkour/freerunning mechanic is the main draw of this game, you can essentially climb any wall within reason, jump ledges, slide under obstacles or behind cover. It is a feature which worked well and gave the game a good "feel" to it, as your mobility was greatly increased. The graphics are relatively good despite the style leaving some things to be desired, some regions have low res textures (even on max), the character models look extremely similar even with the customization options (although the contrast of the slums and the ark is well done in level design/graphical appearance). The problem with this game at the time of writting this review is the online is effectively dead, either being too laggy or being nobody playing ever, which is kind of depressing because I did enjoy the game despite its flaws, and the game is obviously orientated towards multiplayer. As a result I cannot recommend this game unless you can purchase it for very cheap and are looking for a gaming experience which takes between 5-10hours for everything.

There's tons of guns to play with but many feel the same and it's hard to tell them apart. Not worth your time or money.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2014
												Very solid team-based shooter. I played Enemy Territory competetively back in the day and always meant to pick up Brink, but got busy with other things and didn't want to get wrapped up in another multiplayer game at the time. Now that I've put some time into it I'm wondering what went wrong? It's a damn solid game... the few online games I managed to get into were extremely fun and there's a level of quality here that has really held up well over the last few years.In my opinion, Brink is one of those underestimated gems that could really benefit from the (yes, I know) free-to-play business model. A lot of people are probably hesitant to drop $20 on it, considering it rarely goes on sale- so they will never know how good it actually is. There's a ton of visual customization upgrades already built into the game, they should honestly just slap price tags on those and re-release Brink as F2P.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2013
												Don't believe the hate. The art style, mechanics and customization, along with my fond PS3 memories of full 8v8 player teams back in the glory days combine to make this one of my favorite games of all time. If I had to pick ONE game to keep installed on my PC for the rest of my life, it would be Brink hands down. If not to play it, then at least for nostalgia's sake in memory of the fantastic times we shared. To appreciate it as a work of art, and a game design triumph.May be well past its prime, with a dead community and repetitive singleplayer... but pitch some Brink to me and I'll be down to play, any day.

												BRINK in a nutshell. Look at a gun! *game crashes*. Play a mission! *game crashes*. number of helpful: 11 of 24 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												What to say about BRINK.Primarily -- do not buy this game: it is multiplayer focused and currently has no online community, rendering it a dead product.This is a game that was touted with a great amount of potential in its "free-running" parkour-like movement system, its stylised aesthetic full of realistic human models and the plurality of their costumes and faces.Ultimately, while these two strong selling points partially deliver, the game is let down by its pathetic Artificial Intelligence system and buggy mutliplayer implementation, which killed it before it got out of the gate. The class system based on experience provides questionable benefits requiring a huge investment of time to unlock, quite a long time after you will be bored of the game itself. The free-running aspect which has an interesting slant to it suffers in execution: it is too difficult to navigate, often vertically, while still combining gunplay and avoiding opponents in the first person perspective.Avoid.

number of helpful: 6 of 14 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 1, 2014
												Good mix of sp and mp game. Good audio-visuals. Nice (rather small/medium) maps. Great movement mechanics - very fluid. Various body types allow different weapons and different level of movement freedom (light - very fast and able to climb, medium - fast, but not that agile, thick - bullet sponge+turtle movement+no vertical advantage). Two factions offer different stories. Guns are ok and so are the perks. Classess are standard - engineer, assault, spy and medic. Customization of your character and weapons is pretty rich. Solo game allows bots, so you don't run all by yourself when people don't join. Game is objective based - there is no standard DM/TDM/CTF. I would say that it has potential, but something didn't click. It is still enjoyable even with bots - they tend to do well (not perfect but enough to win all maps and finish the story).  I still play it at times - a map or two. Fun thing.Performance on this is weird. It doesn't need powerful PC (I'd say weak on will do), but I faced sudden crashes on 2 of my machines (one under Win XP SP3 and Win 7 x64 Ultimate SP1 and laptop with Win 8.1 x64). Graphics is ok, nothing extreme in any direction. It has a touch of cartoon/cel shading. Sound is good (voice, guns, ambience). Controls are fine and the port seems solid (just those sudden crashes on different machines).

content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												Today's Review: BrinkPersonal Overview: At first i had doubts about this game, basically because by the time i got this game i was running on Windows 7 32bits, since the game requires at least a 64os system, i had to search for a patch to be able to play it, i was using the very same pc than that time but in that moment the game ran in minimun like crap (slow as 5 fps with fps drops and constant stuntering), 2 years later i've decided to install the game running under the same machine with Windows 7 64 and the experience was BEAUTIFUL, i'm talking about max resolution with high quality and even high quality process, and the game starts here:Brink is a first person shooter (FPS) set in a future where we live in the last human refugee "The ARK" a place is falling in decadence and there are 2 groups heavily armed and organized: one in favor to stay in the ARK in the middle of the ocean and fight for the place, and the other group wanting to leave and search for another place, game resambles pretty much the online part of call of duty black ops 2, history is set as multiplayer maps with an objective, there are some RPG factors as "abilities" (at first you think, i might trust ID to make an fps, they have a story with it, but bethesta? let me tell you, YES!)Overall Metascore: 87/100 "Exelent piece of work, get it!"

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												"The future of shooters..."yeah, that's what some big-time pre-reviewer said about the game months before it came out.Maybe "Brink" is the secret subconscious symbolic Illuminati slang-short for Boring(k).What can I say, for the past few months up until present half the New York City buses had the Brink ads on either side posted.The game has been given special care, very special care...by the advertisers. I also feel bad for people who pre-ordered this game.If one was to take one quick general look at the game, he or she wouldn't necessarily find anything wrong with it. But that's the thing about Brink. It has a catchy name and flashy gun fights, but underneath it all is either broken or overdone mechanics.Don't get me wrong, the weapon recoil is realistic and short burst from just about any gun will do the job. In general the gun-shooting feels right, but sometimes it does take more than a magazine clip to clip someone.I like the general mobility of the character you play but I was under the impression that there would be more wall bouncing, and more obstacles to easily climb on and climb through. So for the most part, you will end up doing the same thing: sprint, slow down, peek, crouch, shoot, step back and reload, repeat until you are dead or bleeding, respawn, repeat...Well, there are team objectives to complete, but most of these objectives are same or similar - we've seen it all before.I also realize that plenty of multiplayer games out there have the auto-healing, which I quite frankly despise. But this game takes it to a whole other level. Your health fully regenerates within 4-5 seconds, the only time you need a medic is when you are bleeding on the ground which is when a medic can run up and give you the adrenaline serum.There is also less than ten maps. And I KNOW what they are going to do next. In a couple of months or so, they will anounce a DLC with "ALL THREE NEW MAPS" for 10 bucks or so....There's no single-player to speak of. I mean it looks like there is one, but once you start playing for either the resistance or the security forces, all you end up with are short skits between skirmishes-NO STORY MODE. Each successful skirmish (map) is slightly harder than the previous one, but all it really is the multiplayer play against the AI - fulfilling the same redundant objectives over and over again.There are also mirror-edge kind of stunts that you can do, only i found the mechanics to be slightly awkward. If you bounce off the walls the right way, you also get points (same for kills) that you later use for customization. So the outcome of your stunts isn't always clear.I can't comment on the severity of the multiplayer bugs and the lag just yet. Maybe the PC servers are slightly better than their console counter-parts, or maybe I got lucky, but they are also much less numerous.The customization was meant to give the overt feeling of individualism, but in the end, it doesn't matter as much, at least to me. The ironic thing however is that after developing my character a little, I was more interested in customizing my weapons and dressing up my avatar as opposed to playing the actual game.Overall, the weapon customization is the one that matters, but that has all been done before in other games.The graphics aren't bad, but they aren't impressive either.I also found it interesting how the soldier class has infinite ammo. This was supposed to be the city on the b.r.i.n.k. of complete collapse, yet somehow you can have infinite ammo.Furthermore, the grenade explosions are laughable. You can also hear the sound of you running but if you look down, you will not see your legs. Also, since this is a port, the aim of your mouse will auto-aim for you as if you are a playing on a controller, cool huh?The so-called co-op in this game doesn't really apply. Because the single player is the same as the multiplayer. It's the same as playing co-op in Battlefield 2 BC, but at least that game has squads, and it is also better at doing everything, and stuff...All in all, there's no real incentive to help out your team mates by giving up your ammo and health serums. You can if you want to, but you don't have to. You can just continue blasting and hoping to get a kill. I am sorry for thinking back to Battlefield, but that game makes you want to help out your team mates and squad mates and rewards that splendid.One of my main gripes with the game is the way it was shown to be in previews and trailers. And that tells you a lot about the Art of Ads. I would also like to know what exactly is so revolutionary about this game.In general, I always thought that the future of shooters started with Battlefield Bad Company 2 and it will probably end with Battlefield 3.In the end, I think Bethesda should have focused more on making the next Fallout, only this time in NYC.P.S. The elongated, pickle-head faces are annoying

You can if you want to, but you don't have to. You can just continue blasting and hoping to get a kill. I am sorry for thinking back to Battlefield, but that game makes you want to help out your team mates and squad mates and rewards that splendid.One of my main gripes with the game is the way it was shown to be in previews and trailers. And that tells you a lot about the Art of Ads. I would also like to know what exactly is so revolutionary about this game.In general, I always thought that the future of shooters started with Battlefield Bad Company 2 and it will probably end with Battlefield 3.In the end, I think Bethesda should have focused more on making the next Fallout, only this time in NYC.P.S. The elongated, pickle-head faces are annoying

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												What was an interesting concept turned into a burning tire rolling down a hill. The game is well polished and has a interesting art style that isnt to bold but the fact that this "storytelling" game relys completely on multiplayer gameplay to flesh out the plot makes it crash and burn.I feel all games should be able to support themselves on some form of single player gameplay. If the player cannot enjoy the game by themselves then there isn't any point to it. Granted you can play with bots but after two "matches" the player feels confined in the adequately programmed AI. This game's multiplayer is dead as well since a majority of people who were interested in this game wised up and went on to do better things with their time.But if you have a bunch of friends and extra cash coupled with free time I can see this being a worth while thing. But that is the only circumstance this game is viable for.

I guess that's considered a "challenge" rather than "cheating"? What happened to actually making things challenging, rather than changing the rules of physics?Quite frankly, after a couple of hours of enduring (I use the term accurately) a "game" like this, I fail to see the attraction. Team Fortress is MUCH more fun, this game just makes things annoying. For instance, I get LAG - opponents teleport across the screen - even though I'm playing completely solo. WTF is that about?

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 9, 2016
												Em primeiro lugar uma decepção sem dúvida alguma.BRINK é um jogo de tiro em primeira pessoa desenvolvido pela Splash Damage e publicado pela Bethesda Softworks para Windows, PlayStation 3 e Xbox 360 Lançado em 2011.Brink tem lugar na Arca, uma cidade feita pelo homem flutuante que está à beira de uma guerra civil.Ela deveria abrigar 5.000 pessoas, no entanto está abrigando aproximadamente 50.000. Desta forma, esta situação se torna insustentável e os residentes começam a ficar rapidamente insatisfeitos com a falta de comida, roupas e água potável, assim nasce  "Resistance", que luta pela adequado fornecimento desses suprimentos. Com as tensões entre os dois grupos em crescimento, forças de segurança e resistência são trancados em uma batalha aquecida para o controle da Arca.Após a negação deste fornecimento pelos líderes da Arca, a Resistance se prepara para tentar tomar o poder e distribuir água e comida gratuitamente, uma vez que defendem a idéia de que a Arca tem recursos renováveis suficientes para tal. Com as tensões entre os dois grupos em crescimento, forças de Security e Resistance são trancados em uma batalha aquecida para o controle da Arca.É possível jogar com ambas as facções, Security ou Resistance.Single-player, co-op e jogabilidade multiplayer até 16 jogadore uma experiência perfeita, também permitindo-lhe desenvolver o seu personagem. BRINK focado em movimentos de Parkour aonde precisamente não tem nada de especial, depois não existe prazer ao jogar simplesmente não da vontade de continuar o que é muito negativo.Tinha tudo para ser um excelente jogo mas falhou.Já tentei jogar este jogo 3 vezes 3 oportunidades para mim é impossivel não consigo.Which side will you choose?Humiliation ★☆☆☆☆

												Hey you guys its me reviewing (after three years upon it's release) Brink.First off, no I can't really explain the campaign to you guys, as I haven't been able to get past a certain mission, because the AI goes full retard mode on the second objective...I'll get it eventually, BY MYSELF.And second any idiot who says the shooting in this game is awefull or the storyline sucks, is a dunce, who is used to the real crappy plots, and shots, like 'modern warfare' and 'black ops' (aka♥♥♥♥♥♥of dooty).Now I will admit I expected so much more out of the engine that created 'Rage' another wrongfully bashed game, but this game scratches that Itch that I so badly wanted from rage...PVP SHOOTERthis game is incredibly complex wit class skills, aside from weapons, and smoothe character and weapons customization.all in all it is an ok game the multiplayer is kinda dead but only because people thrive on negativity, so thusly to one guy its bad so everyone else must follow.7.8/10

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												The poster-boy for failure to launch. The trailers and previews were dotted with lies, talking about a "seamless experience" and how you would want to fight with your faction to "control" parts of the ARK. Consistently, they implied it would be an MMOFPS-style game, where you'd move between zones, then be pulled into multiplayer encounters.What we got was a bog-standard, class-based, objective-focused FPS with a half-baked parkour system, decent character customization, janky controls and extremely spotty hit detection/lag compensation. Regularly you will die without knowing why, or pound a clip into an opponent only to be killed by a single shot in reprisal.As others have said, this game is garbage. Ignoring the fact that the servers are likely dead as hell by now, it should be a stern reminder (and is to me,) to never preorder without all the facts. I wish that the store rating system had existed back when Brink came out--I could've helped save a lot of people 60$.I still wear the TF2 hat they gave me for preordering as a reminder to be vigiliant.As a reminder... of my shame.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												i'm started playing single player 3 nights ago 8/28/2014, installed from DVD and activated and updated through steam. i get under 20FPS and overclocking my FX8350 to 4.4 had no effect, so it is not a CPU bottleneck, also my HD7870 is @30-40%i struggled through the first few missions with the 17-19fps on the rebel side until i noticed the broken AI. i'm on a defend mission for the first 5 and a half minutes of defending i kill about 15 enemies, with most of the fighting being done in a different area by the AI controlled players.  then the last 30 seconds of the defense hits, then ALL OF THE ENEMY AI converge on my point, i manage to kill 1-2, then the 17-19fps drops even lower to a 10-15fps making it to were the AI are able to kill me and i feel like i am moving in slow motion, which is sickning.  so they capture point 1, some doors open then i have to defend a safe. same story, no enemies close to the objective for the time of the mission, until the last 30 seconds, then all of them converge on the point, take it in to overtime and also dropping the frame rate back down to 10-15fps, if it wasn't for me having a little better of a position they would of won.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2014
												Oo, This Game... For any of you that Haven't seen Angry Joe's review of this Game, let me Summarize:Brink is an unfinished, buggy as hell, frustrating mess of a game that has a lot of great ideas, but little to no Execution. The Parkour mixed with Guns gameplay seemed like a good idea, but it ends up being a watered down version of Mirror's Edge. In places, that's honestly what this game strives to be. It tries so unbelievably hard to be good, but it just misses the mark. Brink was a good idea, and had it been executed properly, I'm sure that it could've been good. But, it just doesn't make it, I'm Afraid.I Give BRINK 4/10 (Far Below Average)

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 18, 2012
												EDIT: Just changed my rating to negative (it should have always been), since Steam didn't allow for negative reviews at the time I wrote this.Brink is the poster child for trying to do many things right, and failing at every single one.It is a class-based multiplayer FPS. Don't even try to play it single player, since you will still be playing on the small multiplayer maps, but with idiotic bots.This game, in attempting to mimic Team Fortress 2's success (and style), attempts to fix things that weren't broken, introduce new mechanics that are pointless and frustrating, and ignore every legitimate issue.Classes are hardly any different at all (at least in the beginning), with identical mechanics. Literally the only fundamental difference is what you face when you hold down your use key.Get ready to spam your use key, die a LOT, and question existential things such as "what's the point of it all?" Or better yet, just don't buy it. If you already did, delete it. It is the aborted fetus of Mirror's Edge and Team Fortress 2, that somehow still lives, wandering around horrifying people. Kill it with fire.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												i'm started playing single player 3 nights ago 8/28/2014, installed from DVD and activated and updated through steam. i get under 20FPS and overclocking my FX8350 to 4.4 had no effect, so it is not a CPU bottleneck, also my HD7870 is @30-40%i struggled through the first few missions with the 17-19fps on the rebel side until i noticed the broken AI. i'm on a defend mission for the first 5 and a half minutes of defending i kill about 15 enemies, with most of the fighting being done in a different area by the AI controlled players.  then the last 30 seconds of the defense hits, then ALL OF THE ENEMY AI converge on my point, i manage to kill 1-2, then the 17-19fps drops even lower to a 10-15fps making it to were the AI are able to kill me and i feel like i am moving in slow motion, which is sickning.  so they capture point 1, some doors open then i have to defend a safe. same story, no enemies close to the objective for the time of the mission, until the last 30 seconds, then all of them converge on the point, take it in to overtime and also dropping the frame rate back down to 10-15fps, if it wasn't for me having a little better of a position they would of won.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												An FPS game made by Bethesda with in depth class sets, player customization, an interesting story and incredibly fun parkour? What could go wrong!? So much......Brink was one of my top picks at E3 in 2010. Projecting tactical gameplay, of the likes seen in Counter Strike and an abundance of customizations for weapons and characters alike. Unfortunatly this game goes down as one of my most dissapointing purchases. Everything that was presented fell short. With the customization lacking the depth that was promised, the four class sets becoming incredibly boring, so many glitches that the AI becomes undefeatable and a story that grows incredibly boring it wasnt even necessary to have. Playing as the bad guys is fun, weapons are balanced and parkour is spot on. But there is more negatives than positives in Brink and for that I give it a 5/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												The poster-boy for failure to launch. The trailers and previews were dotted with lies, talking about a "seamless experience" and how you would want to fight with your faction to "control" parts of the ARK. Consistently, they implied it would be an MMOFPS-style game, where you'd move between zones, then be pulled into multiplayer encounters.What we got was a bog-standard, class-based, objective-focused FPS with a half-baked parkour system, decent character customization, janky controls and extremely spotty hit detection/lag compensation. Regularly you will die without knowing why, or pound a clip into an opponent only to be killed by a single shot in reprisal.As others have said, this game is garbage. Ignoring the fact that the servers are likely dead as hell by now, it should be a stern reminder (and is to me,) to never preorder without all the facts. I wish that the store rating system had existed back when Brink came out--I could've helped save a lot of people 60$.I still wear the TF2 hat they gave me for preordering as a reminder to be vigiliant.As a reminder... of my shame.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2011
												Brink? More like Uninstalled: The Video GameUgh I was really hesitant to buy this knowing full well what I was getting into and folded to peer pressure by people who quite honestly were ignorant of the game's development history. I don't claim to be an expert on it, but I knew I played enough QUAKE WARS to know that Brink was a game to wait on reviews for before purchasing.I viewed Quake Wars as a preview to Brink's philosophy. Quake Wars required intense pub cooperation that was above and beyond most players' expectations of simple and straightforward team deathmatch.Brink's primarily failing was pretty simple to me. It didn't present a preview of each map to the player, leading everybody who played it to get lost, or behave in a way that was disadvantageous to them because of designed ignoranceThe game's pacing is just plain slow and unrewarding. Even the competitive scene panned this game, The GIANTBOMB.COM CLICK QUICK LOOK http://www.giantbomb.com/brink/61-26694

number of helpful: 3 of 9 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19
												0/10 completely worthless because of one of the dumbest things I've ever seen, it locks your fps to 30 in offline solo play, which is bad since mp has been dead from day 1, and because its overall quality is severely lacking and is often completely deprived of basic necessary qualities.I've always wanted to see if this was decent because it looked alright and I read you could set up your own dedicated private server to play solo to avoid the incredibly stupid 30 fps single player cap. I got it for $3 on humblebundle and did all that. Turns out you can't progress the campaign missions that way, it's just private online solo play. Offline solo locks the game at 30fps, online solo/co-op lets you hit 60fps. One of the dumbest things I've ever seen. Anyway, I was lucky and when I selected campaign online co-op mode there was amazingly a couple servers and one had a 50 ping so I could actually play the campaign missions at 60fps. I was the only person on it with 15 other bots of course. But how long would that server be up and why was it in the first place? Who knows who ♥♥♥♥ing cares, time to give the game a fair chance.It turned out to be the worst team shooter I have ever played, like a really crappy rip-off of TF2. It is junky, clunky, and janky, with the graphics and sounds being its only worthwhile points. The only game mode I saw was either defend a point or attack a point. The side objectives are mostly pointless and are just worthless distractions from the real goal. Some are useful, like blowing up a wall to make a shorter point to the objective, but the enemy can easily swarm it, kill you and all the bots there, and patch it up, or just close it back up when nobody is around which is very easily done. So really the gameplay is extremely basic.Teammate AI can be decent but are mostly just a bunch of dumber than hell bots. Enemy AI is worse and are very poorly balanced. They either stand there while you kill them, fire back a little, or are one-shot kill masters. That was the biggest problem I came across and it is bad. Quite often when you suddenly come up on a enemy they will one-shot headshot kill you in a millisecond before you can react. It is extremely annoying. The other huge problem that is constantly aggravating is some of the most annoying knockback I have ever seen. It is caused by enemies melee'ing you when in close or by grenade blast radius. Your entire view gets knocked back and lowered to simulate a knockback/knockdown combination effect. It is violent and jarring and massively irritating. It's like getting the most annoying video game b-tch slap in gaming history and it happens a lot. As far as the missions go, some are easily fail-able with no proper indication as to why. I failed mission 5 3 times in a row when I thought we were doing well, defending a point that it told me to. That was the point when combined with the overall bad quality of the entire game, made me uninstall this and try to forget I ever wasted my time on this total mess.The game is just overall a badly executed poor man's version of much more competent team shooters like TF2 and even another dead game, Battleborn. In fact this game makes me want to actually reinstall Battleborn just to play the new mission and two new characters they put out since I quit.

												I don't play many multiplayer games, but this one seemed to have everything I liked: a strong team focus and a few unique twists. Ultimately, though, the clumsy parkour mechanics and lack of true variety left me disappointed. In a gaming world dominated by shooters, it's not hard to find something better. number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful11 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												So when I was a young boy this spectacle of wire frame sliding beauty came. By that I mean the commerciaks were great... but those charlatans!!! People put hard work into this game and that is apparent but the pay off seems to have missed their mark.The main draw to this game was it's hip new slidey macho man randy savage charm that "at the time" seemed inovative and life long...but friends, we were fools.The fast paced shooter has expected elements in a team based FPS including escort, bomb, death match, etc..  It's a bit hectic at times but there is pay off when you pull off elaborate plays utilizing your class ability or equipment. The problem reveals it self when the clunky mobility system drowns out the noise of any seperation from the classes or exchanges of carefully picked equipment. Normally this is a sought after quality when talking about shooters, but the poop in the room that nobody wants to talk about it right under your shoe. The lag spikes (unfortunately they happen alot) along with the dead servers (1-800-CALLMEIFYOUPLAYBRINK), clunky parkour mechanic (#parkourlyfe) and completely vegetable like AI that not only lets you down, but they make you feel sad about real life vegetables. This game shot for the stars but ended up shooting their friend in the woods whilst hunting. Sometimes you can take a buck home friends, but sometimes you kill frank from accounting.-☆☆☆ 3 STARS-NOT A BAD SHOOTER-CLASSES WERE FUN TO PLAY WITH-GHOST TOWN-CLUNKY SOFTCORE PARKOUR-AI IS YOUR NEW MENTALLY CHALLENGED COUSIN

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 20, 2013
												Most dissapointing game of 2011? Yeah. All the hype created over those trailers- the beautiful concept and possibility.I blame the developers for their decision to stray from the intended path and into the "cartoonish" and unrealistic mess the game turned out to be. Personally, I'm not a fan of playing the same storyline twice with only minimal changes(Plant the bomb this time, stop them from planting the bomb next time)- Not only does the campaign have you do both storylines, no time has passed in the game either way- playing as the Security stopping the Rebels from planting the bomb you planted during your Rebel playthrough, for example. The only thing about this game more broken than the story is the combat, nobody dies until you have killed them twice.  First you have to knock them down, say with a headshot of a couple slugs to the chest, you then have to do the same once more to kill them.Just get Blacklight: Retribution, much better, free, not BRINK.

content:
Posted: November 14, 2014
												The game was disappointing enough as a full-price retail release that required Steamworks. It delivers on none of the hype, and a lack of care permeates every aspect of its design, from the imbalanced maps and weapons to the completely uninspired unlock system and lack of features or content. To this day, the game feels unfinished and barely received support after launch. A stain on the name of the studio who brought you the Enemy Territory series, not even Bethesda wants anything to do with it, as they've apparently shut down the master server and now you can only connect directly to servers by specifying IP addresses. A true example of squandered potential, it's not worth your money or your time.

content:
Posted: November 29, 2013
												Brink is a perfect example of a brillinat idea that is executed in a soso manner. Enemy territory players will feel pretty much at home with this, it tries something fresh in terms of every match having a story, a reason behind it, with outcomes based on the winning team. Art style is pretty nice, customization is very fun to use (only issue is you can't custom color your items, just pre-sets.) Sadly I am not sure if many people still play this game, as it had mixed to poor critical review due to bad console versions, but you would have to look into that if you are interested. The game is not for everyone, but if it is for you, someone who loves team based games with a twist, you'll adore this game and look past the flaws. If you are looking for just pure shooter, avoid it.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
												Tl;dr: A fun FPS that brings something new into the market. If you're into Character Customization, be warned that there aren't female characters.Brink is a fun game overall. Gameplay is nice, teams are balanced, and nobody goes home a loser. The fighting is relatively simple. Aim, shoot, kill. But then you factor in ammo resupplies, damage buffs, and armor enhancement, and it complicates the equation. Complicate meaning "funnifies" in this usage. Plus, the movement is unique. Holding sprint activates a kind of "dynamic parkour" feature that allows you to find new paths and move around more fluidly. This also allows for some characters to vault walls taller than them. Class perks and abilities are cool, being able to give someone a damage buff or resupply of ammo. There is also a cool perk system, which as you level up allows for more abilities and tricks to be available to the character. Instead of set perks, they are bought by level coins, a nice feature in my opinion.The story is engaging, albeit short. Depending on which side you play, you get both sides of the story. You can replay any mission as either side and learn their views and reason for fighting. Alongside the main campaign (which can be played solo or multiplayer), there is freeplay and challenges. Freeplay is exactly what it sounds like. Challenges are different tasks that test your ability to use the ingame skillset. The only qualm I have is with 'Parkour This'; I love the parkour aspect of the fighting, but in no way did I ask for you to require me to master it to unlock silencers.I love the character customization. Very simple, clean, and creative. Two things: No girls, and no custom facial/bodily features. I find the lack of girls sad (if you emphasize character customization, you dang better have both genders!) but not game ruining. Yeah, it'd be nice to seduce my enemies into not shooting me, but it's okay to have only guys. The only thing that really grinds my gears is that you are locked to a specific set of facial setups. No big pouty lips and anime eyes here, just a couple dozen near identical faces. On the bright side, each clothing piece comes in an assortment of colors (which often change the patterns of the clothes as well). The face paint and tattoos partially fulfill me in the way of face modification. Overall it's nice, but still makes the character customization just feel like chara custo.One aspect this game displays nicely in gun modification. You can attach multiple enhancements to your gun. That's it. You get a few sights, a couple muzzle brakes (purely cosmetic, still fun), and if you try hard enough, silencers and speed holsters/slings. No camos, nor extreme performance enhancements (which adds to the argument of team balance).Overall I give it an 8.5/10, really fun to play, but has a couple bugs and missing features that kind of harm the gameplay. If you have the money, it's worth it.8.5/10, would knockdown again.(Btw, the reason I complain about Brink not having girls while CoD and Battlefield don't is that advertising character customization implies having women; and I don't think that CoD or Battlefield said that there was a totall of 100+ quadrillion total combinations.)

content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
												This game is beyond the most strategic and action-packed arena game as of late. Indeed the characters are curiously modeled, but it's just Brink's unique graphics. No other arena game- save perhaps Halo Reach, has such a multitude of combinations to create a truly unique character. I suppose there may not be anymore dedicated servers, I've never noticed a different between them and private hosted servers, which Brink has.If you haven't bought the game; buy it. And if you own it, join the Brink universe again, get it back on it's feet.Call of Duty has an impressive arsenal, sure, but there's absolutely no strategy involved, and I'm not certain as I've given up on that franchise, but as far as I'm concerned doesn't have character customizations, as with Brink, your character evolves as you progress. And the combat, with some games it's too complex, or the game itself pratically fights for you, but with Brink you have inumerable ways to approach a firefight, with inumerable guns, and as a character with no equal.

number of helpful: 12 of 33 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 15, 2014
												For all that hipsters and cynics love to mock it, we owe a lot to Brink. It was Brink that set the benchmark for how shooters looked and played in the HD era. It was Brink that redefined the FPS as all-action blockbuster, while transforming multiplayer.The premise is interesting, albeit faintly ridiculous. In the near future a new power – The Federation – rises in South America and its influence begins to spread across the world.  Federation forces attack a US orbital weapon and turn its weapons of mass destruction against the US, blasting half of the states back into the stone age and putting an end to North American dominance of the region.Brink's one shining aspect is SMART (Smooth Movement Across Random Terrain). Using SMART, holding a single button lets you navigate up walls, over obstacles, and through the game world. Depending on your body size, you can do more or less with movement, but overall this finesse is fantastic. Nothing in Brink feels quite as good as sliding under gunfire into someone, taking them out with a shotgun.Brink is by far the worst ♥♥♥♥ing game my friends have ever played! 7/10 A Masterpiece.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												Brink is a good game for a good price. Why? Let me tell you.- Wonderful execution in the control department. Very fluid gameplay, I did not have to change any of the controls from default. It is very smooth. Maybe it's just smooth for me, considering I've spent an embarassingly long time sitting in front of my computer playing Brink.- If you play single player, you will find the AI is on par. They have their weak moments, most definitely. But overall, they function fairly well.- Actual gameplay is more "shoot everything that moves" rather than being on the tactical side. If you like to sit on your laurels and snipe people, this game will not be your favorite. If you generally play a tank-like character who rolls in to battle and blows up everything that breathes, you will love this game.- Sometimes has the feel of a FPS tower defense game. Especially if you play as an engineer. But I don't mind that aspect, and actually enjoy it.- Multiplayer is well developed, but could use more maps and the entire game could use more weapons. You can at least unlock attachments for your guns through the challenge mode included in the main game.- Campaign is interesting. You can play as radical terrorists on the Resistance side or as the grounded Security. There is no advantage or disadvantage to the sides. Weapons are the same. Appearance is only slightly tweaked (different jackets, hair styles, etc etc). I prefer the Security story line only because I like the appearance and dialog better. The story could have been more developed and more levels included, but I can't complain that much. I completed the campaign in a few hours. Replaying it has kept me occupied for a good while, however. Maybe it's jsut because I'm a simple person. My favorite aspect of the entire campaign and story is that you can play both sides and see how the story develops and progresses as you complete levels and objectives. Save the "Ark" or destroy it.OVERALL RATING: 8.8 out of 10. Polished game. Few bugs. Keeps you occupied for a while. Would have liked it to be longer and more in depth with more variation in gameplay. Brink is a good game for a good price.

content:
Posted: June 7, 2014
												The game is actually pretty fun to play, even solo. Obviously a LOT better with friends. It's cool that you can customize your character as well.The biggest gripe I have with this game is the story. It's incredibly short, and really not all that great. The intro scenes before each map seem pretty pointless to me as well. Every intro basically goes the same way: your character stands around holding their gun (and not really doing anything else...) while the other characters complain about the mission as genericly as possible.I would recommend this game for anyone looking for a shorter shooter to tide them over until the next Call of Duty or Battlefield game (which isn't a long wait anyway...), but try to purchase the game while it's on sale. $10 is really the most I would say this is worth, and even that is kinda pushing it....(I personally only paid $5, if I recall correctly)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 3, 2011
												So this one time I was playing Dystopia, and then everyone stopped playing Dystopia because of all the bugs. Luckily, the guys at Bethesda and Splash Damage realized that the best way to get us all back into Dystopia was to create a game that made Dystopia's bugs look much more pleasant by comparison. And so, Brink was created. Thanks to Brink, I've played more Dystopia in the last month than I have been playing in the last year! It's just like that episode of Star Trek The Next Generation where Data has to outsmart his holographic nemesis Professor Moriarty by tricking him into thinking he was somewhere else. Brink tricks you into thinking you like it, but unlike Moriarty most of us are smart enough to realize that we should really just be playing Dystopia, for ♥♥♥♥'s sake. Do yourself a favour and get Dystopia. It's like Brink except much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, better.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 12, 2011
												Brink is something of a confusing topic in the office. We're pretty split down the middle in terms of supporters or detractors, and there seems to be a common thread: Team Fortress 2 players, like the hardcore ones, will not like this game. Everyone else might enjoy it for what it is -- a squad based shooter that REQUIRES teamwork to succeed. If you play online, most people you run into will play really well, but there are a few players that ruin the experience. I'm going to go with a toss up for this one. If you and the rest of your baseball team sized group of friends want to get pumped up before a game or something, this might be for you. If you have a lack of friends who like to play fps games, or are already into TF2, pass.

content:
Posted: February 4, 2014
												Interesting visuals, climatic music, the best AI available in FPS game, especially at Hard difficulty level. Perfect game for anyone interested in a fun multiplayer FPS, especially if he/she prefers to play mainly with bots. The Brink will provide a player with tens if not hundreds of fast-paced, objective-based combat. SMART movement system and Objective Wheel (used also to communicate with your teammates about your intentions, so they can adjust theirs) are both truly ingenious inventions by the Splash Damage. The game is maybe not for everyone, but if you like to play with smart bots and play it a few hours you will probably love it. I hope that Extraction (aka Dirty Bomb) will carry over the best features of Brink (including the AI), and it will deserve to be called Brink 2 (Brink even better).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 6, 2013
												Like everyone else in 2011, I was anticipating Brink, and what it would bring to the table in the myriad of FPS games at the time. It offered some new things to the table, but it kinda screwed itself over with having a foot stuck in the past, and a major identity crisis.A big thing that was advertised was parkour elements, and this was exciting to see, but for something that was so blown up, it's hardly used. You may have to use it to jump over a table or something, but it's not really used that frequently, and it's not even fully unlocked until later in the game.The art style and musical score is a bit underrated in my book, the characters have this cartoony, comic book feel to them, which is a nice touch, but isn't really a selling point.The game teases you with a promising story, and does little to nothing to deliver one. The campaign in this game is basically multiplayer matches with bots, and not in a helpful "Battlefield 2" way, it's more like a "Left 4 Dead times 4" kind of way. Yes, the bots do absolutely nothing except run and shoot things, objectives are ignored, and it makes you wonder why there's even a campaign at all.If this was a multiplayer-only game, that'd be fine, but because this game was crapped on big-time by critics, almost nobody plays it anymore. Which is understandable, considering this game's level cap only goes up to 20, and you can max it out within a day if you really wanted to.Another good concept gone bad by dumb design choices and an overall undercooked game.4 oddly proportioned McLovin's out of 5 for effort.2 out of 5 for the finished concept.

												trying to rip off both tf2 and cod and ends up with the ♥♥♥♥♥iest aspects of both. expected some quick oldschool bunnyhoppy shooter with some parkour elements strewn in. ended up with a constant cluster♥♥♥♥ of grenades and endlessly revived teammates and enemies, pretty much just one gun to choose from (the majority are submachineguns. theyre the only viable option) and the same three maps repeated ad nauseum. singleplayer is non-existant. for what it has to offer visually, the game runs like crap. speaking of visuals, the mix between cartoonish proportions and realistic textures does not work at all, and is not reflected in the environmental design. at best, you could say it falls in the uncanny valley. the customisation option is a pretty useless gimmick if not even a one that hinders gameplay, since you cant tell who is on your side and what class theyre playing.this verdict might sound token, but take the advice: dont get it. even if its free. wasted 50 bucks. biggest piece of buyers remorse i ever had to shame myself for.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												Good game, I'd give it a 7/10.  This game really focuses on the team objective a a little less on the shooting for the sake of shooting.  It definately is a good game to play with friends due to the fact that you must work together.  The parkour is a plus for the game, being that it was one of the earlier FPS's to have that mobility.  Single player is horrible, it really is.  Going around and doing what robots tell you to do and completing objective after objective gets REALLY repetitive and seems pointless.  For me at least, this game always glitches, so that if I spend more than 2 minutes on the character screen it will glitch out and shut down.  I still have not figured out why, but if your into team multiplayer, this is a good pick for you.  And for reference, this game is like a more evolved-combat version of Team Fortress 2.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 4, 2011
												Brink is a mult player game to the core.  The campaign was done so you can play it online against people or bots.  Which sounded awsome when I first heard about it.  And sold me on the game.  Playing the campaign online is pretty much the same as multi player.  The difference is you have objectives to complete and most objectives are defend this attack that which comprise each map in the campaign.  You do get cut scenes in between each map telling the story.  Brink is also a class based FPS with RPG elements.  You can chose from 4 class's Medic, Soldier, Engineer and Recon.  All in all I felt the campaign was to short and I didn't get my money's worth.  The S.M.A.R.T. controls the devs added respond well and are easy to get used to.  For an FPS the controls are top notch.  Weapons handle well with many way's to customize.  Devs releasing the first DLC free.  Hopefully it adds more of what I was looking for. 7/10 my score.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 27, 2011
												A masterpiece unguilty of its own failureBRINK was and still is one of my favourite MP-FPS-games I ever played.The problem is there are few actually playing it, also from people that played it I only heard things like "bad game" and such.I for myself could've been one of them. If I wouldn't have read the conclusion of a writer of a (now no more excisting) magazine.Quote: "You MUST NOT play this as a game where you go like "BOOM HEADSHOT". This is a game you can not enjoy this way. But you WILL enjoy it - promise - if you play it with teamplay and the common goal in mind."I'm incredible greatful to that guy who wrote that and allowed me to enjoy this game.The problem of this game is not its complexity, it has. The problem is not the beefy heavies, dominating CQ. The problem this game has is the FPS-community. The problem is not everybody who played this game read that article, or even wants to play towards a common goal. That is the problem of the game. If you truly want to play together with others, this game is one you should try. But you should not touch it as a shooter, but as a "Common Goal Action Game".

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 7, 2011
												Weird. That's the word that fits BRINK the most imo. The game does a terrible job at explaining itself and you can easily get confused by the cartoony graphics, that make you think that this must be an over the top TF2 style game that allows you to do silly stuff for ♥♥♥♥♥ and giggles right? WRONG. If you want a tight team based game then keep your eye on this title as you'll be hard pressed to find another game that requires more teamwork than this. This game is nigh-impossible to solo/lone-wolf. The only game mode available is objective based. Some objectives can alter the map layout. Combat is medium to close quarters oriented. All weapons/unlocks become available when you finish the tutorial. Only class specific abilities are xp based. 4 classes. Best avatar editor in a FPS game yet. Game encourages you to make different characters tied to different classes. Different body types allow different levels of parkour traversal through the maps. Team players need only apply.

I tried real multiplayer but it seemed just as ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and broken, and I never could seem to be the right class in the moment to move my team forward. Good ideas, broken mechanics. It could have been better.

content:
Posted: August 5, 2011
												Brink is a completely different FPS game than you’re used to. If you think you are going to run around and kill every bad guy to end up on the top of the scoreboard, you’re wrong. This title requires a team effort towards the objective. The controls have a lag or weighted feel to them and are not as responsive as I would like, playable but expect some adaptation time. The visuals are very good but the sound needs work as it will completely stop at times. When playing single player, the AI do not focus on the objectives as much as they should and get caught up in fire fights, wait a second, that’s exactly what happens in online multiplayer as well! :0)  Bottom line: Not much to hold peoples interest,  I give the game a 6.5 out of 10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 2, 2012
												BRINK /would/ be an awesome team-oriented shooter if there was actually more than 5 people online playing it -- on the same server.  This game seriously could have been really good, but there is just a few things wrong with it that don't work that well.  The bots are just horrible, mainly due to their inability to prioritize for objectives.  Also, undisguising as a spy behind a bot will give you away, but if you sneak up behind them undiguised them they will not notice.  The bots have to be the most gamebreaking of all.  The SMART movement is weird to get used to at first, but it becomes a lot easier if you just let it do the work for you, instead of trying to mash jump, crouch, and sprint like you would in other games.  The core game mechanics are actually really good, the secondary objectives offer a twist to traditional team-based objective gameplay, and it's actually very playable overall. This game could have been great, but alas, it just doesn't have the community support.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 9, 2012
												It blows my mind how this went under the radar. Brink is an extremely unique and impressive FPS. There is absolutely *exceptional* character AND weapon personalization, three different character classes each having different positives and negatives, and around a hundred unique character abilities. The campaign, regardless of which of the two factions you decide to fight for, really does an impressive job at making you care about your side. Will you be a freedom fighter trying to resist Ark suppression, or Ark Security trying to put down the terrorist group? The campaign maps are the same but starting points and objectives different, making each faction's campaign different yet tied together quite well. To top it off, the AI, which is terrible in most games, actually *isn't* in Brink. In fact, playing with the AI is usually better, as they actually go after the objectives and help you out with things. Underrated

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 19, 2012
I am updating this review for the sake of being current, but I'm leaving my original review down below as my feelings towards the game itself have not changed.The reality is that this game was so horrendously overlooked it was a damn tragedy. No one plays it anymore. The best you can get is a bot match with maybe a couple real people if you're lucky.The only thing that could save this game is a re-release or an update with developer run servers.Unless the above scenarios happen, do NOT buy this game. Not for $5, not for $1.Original reivew:This game will leave you wanting more, but totally in a good way. I wish there was just more to it. More storyline, more maps, etc. Some maps can be a bit unbalanced, too, but it really just becomes part of the challenge.It puts TF2 to SHAME as far as gameplay, though. Similar roles (engineer, soldier, medic, spy), but with more of an RPG character building element, so you can pick and choose skills in which you'd like your guy to excel. Not a lot of diversity with weapons, but you find yourself becoming more interested with your particular role's abilities, and balancing it out with your weapons of choice. Plus, since any role can pretty much use any weapon (few exceptions), you can really cater to your own playing style.Play this game if you love team-based FPS!

content:
Posted: January 25, 2014
												== SHORT ==I like it, I am happy that I bought it and I feel like I've been delivered the hapiness that I payed for.If you like team and class based FPS and love to customize your character, go ahead, this game is for you.== LONG ==When I came across teaser of this game for first time, I was quite impressed. It promised, super nice movement possibilities and seamless multiplayer/singleplayer experience. Well... They did what they promised in some way. :DSingle/Multiplayer is just simply multiplayer with somewhat storyline, which you can play through with bots, too :) Storyline is a bit more than you would expect from MP game (which is good!), but not really a single player story.Movement capabilities are really there. It's like almost only thing that you can't do is climb tall vertical walls. The rest is possible. Of course, my playing style is more "close and personal", which caused me to choose Heavy body type which is... more...inert than Light body type... So, not that much climbing for me :DCharacter customization, level ups, upgrades, weapons, weapon customization, class based gameplay is very well tuned, too :) Even now from time to time I am enjoying it with my Heavy Enforcer and a Gatling Gun (or something it is called... Essentially, 3 barrel minigun :D )

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 13, 2011
												This game is rushed. The AI is garbage (making one of the challenges nigh impossible), the story is boring (skippable) trash, the voice acting is a little annoying, the free-running is mediocre and nowhere near Mirror's Edge quality; half of the weapons are poorly tuned, multiplayer server searching reduces FPS from 60 to about 2, engineer turrets are little more than a large paperweight (when I think turrets done right, I think TF2). This game is just poorly made. Typical Bethesda work rearing its ugly head.To be fair, the graphics are really nice, the intro character customization is really well done, and the game otherwise runs really smoothly, but there is no way in hell that I can recommend that somebody go out and pay $90 for this when there are plenty of better games out there for under 10 dollars.Don't bother buying this. Go buy TF2 instead.
